beginning god created heaven earth
earth without form void darkness upon face deep spirit god moved waters
god said let there light
god saw light good divided darkness
god called light day darkness night evening morning first
god said let there firmament midst waters divide
god made firmament divided waters under above so
god called firmament heaven evening morning second day
god said let waters under heaven gathered together one place dry land appear so
god called dry land earth gathering together waters seas saw good
god said let earth bring forth grass herb yielding seed fruit tree after kind whose itself upon so
earth brought forth grass herb yielding seed after kind tree fruit whose itself god saw good
evening morning third day
god said let there lights firmament heaven divide day night signs seasons days years
let lights firmament heaven give light upon earth so
god made two great lights greater light rule day lesser night stars also
god set firmament heaven give light upon earth
rule over day night divide light darkness god saw good
evening morning fourth day
god said let waters bring forth abundantly moving creature hath life fowl may fly above earth open firmament heaven
god created great whales every living creature moveth waters brought forth abundantly after kind winged fowl saw good
god blessed saying fruitful multiply fill waters seas let fowl earth
evening morning fifth day
god said let earth bring forth living creature after kind cattle creeping thing beast so
god made beast earth after kind cattle every thing creepeth upon saw good
god said let us make man our image after likeness dominion over fish sea fowl air cattle earth every creeping thing creepeth upon
so god created man own image male female
god blessed said fruitful multiply replenish earth subdue dominion over fish sea fowl air every living thing moveth upon
god said behold given you every herb bearing seed upon face earth tree fruit yielding meat
every beast earth fowl air thing creepeth upon wherein there life given green herb meat so
god saw every thing had made behold very good evening morning sixth day
thus heavens earth finished host
on seventh day god ended work had made rested
god blessed seventh day sanctified because had rested work created made
these generations heavens earth created day lord god made
every plant field before earth herb grew lord god had caused rain upon there man till ground
there went mist earth watered whole face ground
lord god formed man dust ground breathed nostrils breath life became living soul
lord god planted garden eastward eden there put man whom had formed
out ground made lord god grow every tree pleasant sight good food life also midst garden knowledge evil
river went out eden water garden thence parted became four heads
name first pison compasseth whole land havilah where there gold
gold land good there bdellium onyx stone
name second river gihon same compasseth whole land ethiopia
name third river hiddekel goeth toward east assyria fourth euphrates
lord god took man put garden eden dress keep
lord god commanded man saying every tree garden thou mayest freely eat
tree knowledge good evil thou shalt eat day eatest thereof surely die
lord god said good man should alone make help meet
out ground lord god formed every beast field fowl air brought adam see what would call whatsoever called living creature name thereof
adam gave names cattle fowl air every beast field there found help meet
lord god caused deep sleep fall upon adam slept took one ribs closed flesh instead thereof
rib lord god had taken man made woman brought her
adam said now bone bones flesh she called woman because taken out man
therefore man leave father mother cleave wife one flesh
both naked man wife ashamed
now serpent more subtil than any beast field lord god had made said woman yea hath ye eat every tree garden
woman said serpent we may eat fruit trees garden
fruit tree midst garden god hath said ye eat neither touch lest die
serpent said woman ye surely die
god doth know day ye eat thereof then your eyes opened gods knowing good evil
woman saw tree good food pleasant eyes desired make one wise she took fruit thereof did eat gave also her husband
eyes both opened knew naked sewed fig leaves together made themselves aprons
heard voice lord god walking garden cool day adam wife hid themselves presence amongst trees
lord god called adam said where art thou
said heard thy voice garden afraid because naked hid myself
said who told thee thou wast naked hast eaten tree whereof commanded shouldest eat
man said woman whom thou gavest she gave tree did eat
lord god said woman what thou hast done serpent beguiled did eat
lord god said serpent because thou hast done art cursed above cattle every beast field upon thy belly shalt go dust eat days life
put enmity between thee woman thy seed her bruise head thou shalt heel
woman said greatly multiply thy sorrow conception thou shalt bring forth children desire husband rule over thee
adam said because thou hast hearkened voice thy wife eaten tree commanded thee saying shalt eat cursed ground sake sorrow days life
thorns also thistles bring forth thee thou shalt eat herb field
sweat thy face shalt thou eat bread till return ground out wast taken dust art
adam called wife's name eve because she mother living
adam also wife did lord god make coats skins clothed
lord god said behold man become one us know good evil now lest put forth hand take also tree life eat live ever
therefore lord god sent forth garden eden till ground whence taken
so drove out man placed at east garden eden cherubims flaming sword turned every way keep tree life
adam knew eve wife she conceived bare cain said gotten man lord
she again bare brother abel keeper sheep cain tiller ground
process time came pass cain brought fruit ground offering lord
abel also brought firstlings flock fat thereof lord had respect offering
cain offering had respect very wroth countenance fell
lord said cain why art thou wroth thy countenance fallen
if thou doest well shalt accepted sin lieth at door thee desire rule over
cain talked abel brother came pass field rose against slew
lord said cain where abel thy brother know am brother's keeper
said what hast thou done voice thy brother's blood crieth ground
now art thou cursed earth hath opened her mouth receive thy brother's blood hand
thou tillest ground henceforth yield thee her strength fugitive vagabond shalt earth
cain said lord punishment greater than can bear
behold thou hast driven out day face earth thy hid fugitive vagabond come pass every one findeth slay
lord said therefore whosoever slayeth cain vengeance taken on sevenfold set mark upon lest any finding should kill
cain went out presence lord dwelt land nod on east eden
cain knew wife she conceived bare enoch builded city called name after son

brother's name jubal father such handle harp organ

now abraham sarah old well stricken age ceased after manner women
therefore sarah laughed within herself saying after am waxed old pleasure lord being also

any thing too hard lord at time appointed return thee according life sarah son
then sarah denied saying laughed she afraid said nay thou didst laugh

lord said hide abraham thing do
seeing abraham surely become great mighty nation nations earth blessed
know command children household after keep way lord do justice judgment may bring upon abraham hath spoken
lord said because cry sodom gomorrah great sin very grievous
go down now see whether done altogether according cry come if know
men turned faces thence went toward sodom abraham stood yet before lord
abraham drew near said wilt thou also destroy righteous wicked
peradventure there fifty righteous within city wilt thou also destroy spare place therein
far thee do after manner slay righteous wicked should judge earth right
lord said if find sodom fifty righteous within city then spare place sakes
abraham answered said behold now taken upon speak lord am dust ashes
peradventure there lack five fifty righteous wilt thou destroy city said if find forty
spake yet again said peradventure there forty found do forty's sake
said oh let lord angry speak peradventure there thirty found do if find
said behold now taken upon speak lord peradventure there twenty found destroy twenty's sake
said oh let lord angry speak yet once peradventure ten found there destroy ten's sake
lord went way soon had left communing abraham returned place
there came two angels sodom at even lot sat gate seeing rose meet bowed himself face toward ground
said behold now lords turn pray you your servant's house tarry night wash feet ye rise early go on ways nay we abide street
pressed upon greatly turned entered house made feast did bake unleavened bread eat
before lay down men city even sodom compassed house round both old young people every quarter
called lot said where men came thee night bring out us we may know
lot went out at door shut after
said pray you brethren do so wickedly
behold now two daughters known man let pray you bring out do ye good your eyes only these men nothing therefore came under shadow roof
said stand back again one fellow came sojourn needs judge now we deal worse thee than pressed sore upon man even lot near break door
men put forth hand pulled lot house shut door
smote men at door house blindness both small great so wearied themselves find
men said lot hast thou here any besides son law thy sons daughters whatsoever city bring out place
we destroy place because cry waxen great before face lord hath sent us
lot went out spake sons law married daughters said get you place lord destroy city seemed one mocked
morning arose then angels hastened lot saying arise take thy wife two daughters here lest thou consumed iniquity city
while lingered men laid hold upon hand wife two daughters lord being merciful brought forth set without city
came pass had brought forth abroad said escape thy life look behind thee neither stay thou plain mountain lest consumed
lot said oh so lord
behold now thy servant hath found grace sight thou hast magnified mercy shewed saving life cannot escape mountain lest some evil take die
behold now city near flee little one oh let escape thither soul live
said see accepted thee concerning thing also overthrow city thou hast spoken
haste thee escape thither cannot do any thing till thou come therefore name city called zoar
sun risen upon earth lot entered zoar
then lord rained upon sodom gomorrah brimstone fire out heaven
overthrew those cities plain inhabitants grew upon ground
wife looked back behind she became pillar salt
abraham gat early morning place where stood before lord
looked toward sodom gomorrah land plain beheld lo smoke country went furnace
came pass god destroyed cities plain remembered abraham sent lot out midst overthrow overthrew dwelt
lot went out zoar dwelt mountain two daughters feared dwell cave
firstborn said younger our father old there man earth come us after manner
come let us make our father drink wine we lie may preserve seed

made father drink wine night also younger arose lay perceived she down nor

firstborn bare son called name moab same father moabites day

abraham said sarah wife she sister abimelech king gerar sent took

abimelech had come near her said lord wilt thou slay also righteous nation
said she sister even herself brother integrity heart innocency hands done
god said dream yea know thou didst integrity thy heart also withheld thee sinning against therefore suffered touch her
now therefore restore man wife prophet pray thee thou shalt live if her know surely die thine
therefore abimelech rose early morning called servants told these things ears men sore afraid
then abimelech called abraham said what hast thou done us offended thee brought on kingdom great sin deeds ought
abimelech said abraham what sawest thou hast done thing
abraham said because thought surely fear god place slay wife's sake
yet indeed she sister daughter father mother became wife
came pass god caused wander father's house said her thy kindness thou shalt shew at every place whither we come say brother
abimelech took sheep oxen menservants womenservants gave abraham restored sarah wife
abimelech said behold land before thee dwell where pleaseth
sarah said behold given thy brother thousand pieces silver thee covering eyes other thus she reproved
so abraham prayed god healed abimelech wife maidservants bare children
lord had fast closed wombs house abimelech because sarah abraham's wife
lord visited sarah had said did spoken
sarah conceived bare abraham son old age at set time god had spoken
abraham called name son born whom sarah bare isaac
abraham circumcised son isaac being eight days old god had commanded
abraham hundred years old son isaac born
sarah said god hath made laugh so hear
she said who would abraham sarah should given children suck born son old age
child grew weaned abraham made great feast same day isaac
sarah saw son hagar egyptian she had born abraham mocking
wherefore she said abraham cast out bondwoman her son heir even isaac
thing very grievous abraham's sight because son
god said abraham let grievous thy sight because lad bondwoman sarah hath thee hearken her voice isaac seed called
also son bondwoman make nation because thy seed
abraham rose early morning took bread bottle water gave hagar putting on her shoulder child sent away she departed wandered wilderness beersheba
water spent bottle she cast child under one shrubs
she went sat her down over against good way off bowshot said let see death child lift voice wept
god heard voice lad angel called hagar out heaven said her what aileth thee fear hath where
arise lift lad hold thine hand make great nation
god opened her eyes she saw well water went filled bottle gave lad drink
god lad grew dwelt wilderness became archer
dwelt wilderness paran mother took wife out land egypt
came pass at time abimelech phichol chief captain host spake abraham saying god thee thou doest
now therefore swear here by god thou wilt deal falsely nor son son's according kindness done thee shalt do land wherein hast sojourned
abraham said swear
abraham reproved abimelech because well water abimelech's servants had violently taken away
abimelech said wot who hath done thing neither didst thou tell yet heard day
abraham took sheep oxen gave abimelech both made covenant
abraham set seven ewe lambs flock by themselves
abimelech said abraham what mean these seven ewe lambs thou hast set by themselves
said these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take hand may witness digged well
wherefore called place beersheba because there sware both
thus made covenant at beersheba then abimelech rose phichol chief captain host returned land philistines
abraham planted grove beersheba called there on name lord everlasting god
abraham sojourned philistines' land many days
came pass after these things god did tempt abraham said behold here am
said take now thy son thine only isaac whom thou lovest get thee land moriah offer there burnt offering upon one mountains tell
abraham rose early morning saddled ass took two young men isaac son clave wood burnt offering went place god had told
then on third day abraham lifted eyes saw place afar off
abraham said young men abide ye here ass lad go yonder worship come again you
abraham took wood burnt offering laid upon isaac son fire hand knife went both together
isaac spake abraham father said here am son behold fire wood where lamb burnt offering
abraham said son god provide himself lamb burnt offering so went both together
came place god had told abraham built altar there laid wood order bound isaac son on upon
abraham stretched forth hand took knife slay son
angel lord called out heaven said abraham here am
said lay thine hand upon lad neither do thou any thing now know fearest god seeing hast withheld thy son only
abraham lifted eyes looked behold behind ram caught thicket by horns went took offered burnt offering stead son
abraham called name place jehovahjireh said day mount lord seen
angel lord called abraham out heaven second time
said by myself sworn saith lord because thou hast done thing withheld thy son thine only
blessing bless thee multiplying multiply thy seed stars heaven sand upon sea shore possess gate enemies
thy seed nations earth blessed because thou hast obeyed voice
so abraham returned young men rose went together beersheba dwelt at
came pass after these things told abraham saying behold milcah she hath also born children thy brother nahor
huz firstborn buz brother kemuel father aram
chesed hazo pildash jidlaph bethuel

concubine whose name reumah she bare also tebah gaham thahash maachah
sarah hundred seven twenty years old these life
sarah died kirjatharba same hebron land canaan abraham came mourn weep her
abraham stood before dead spake sons heth saying
am stranger sojourner you give possession buryingplace may bury dead out sight
children heth answered abraham saying
hear us lord thou art mighty prince among choice our sepulchres bury thy dead none withhold thee sepulchre mayest
abraham stood bowed himself people land even children heth
communed saying if your mind should bury dead out sight hear intreat ephron son zohar
may give cave machpelah hath end field much money worth possession buryingplace amongst you
ephron dwelt among children heth hittite answered abraham audience even went at gate city saying
nay lord hear field give thee cave therein presence sons people bury thy dead
abraham bowed down himself before people land
spake ephron audience people land saying if thou wilt give pray thee hear money field take bury dead there
ephron answered abraham saying
lord hearken land worth four hundred shekels silver what betwixt thee bury therefore thy dead
abraham hearkened ephron weighed silver had named audience sons heth four hundred shekels current money merchant
field ephron machpelah before mamre cave therein trees borders round about made sure

after abraham buried sarah wife cave field machpelah before mamre same hebron land canaan
field cave therein made sure abraham possession buryingplace by sons heth
abraham old well stricken age lord had blessed things
abraham said eldest servant house ruled over had put pray thee thy hand under thigh

abraham said beware thou bring son thither again
lord god heaven took father's house land kindred spake sware saying thy seed give send angel before thee thou shalt take wife son thence
if woman willing follow thee then thou shalt clear oath only bring son thither again
servant put hand under thigh abraham master sware concerning matter

made camels kneel down without city by well water at time evening even women go out draw
said o lord god master abraham pray thee send good speed day shew kindness
behold stand here by well water daughters men city come out draw

came pass before had done speaking behold rebekah out who born bethuel son milcah wife nahor abraham's brother her pitcher upon shoulder
damsel very fair look upon virgin neither had any man known her she went down well filled pitcher came

she said drink lord hasted let down her pitcher upon hand gave
she had done giving drink said draw water thy camels also until drinking
she hasted emptied her pitcher trough ran again well draw water drew camels
man wondering at her held peace wit whether lord had made journey prosperous or

said blessed lord god master abraham who hath left destitute mercy truth being way led house master's brethren

said am abraham's servant

behold stand by well water come pass virgin cometh forth draw say her give pray thee little thy pitcher drink

these generations isaac abraham's son abraham begat
isaac forty years old took rebekah wife daughter bethuel syrian padanaram sister laban

children struggled together within her she said if so why am thus went enquire lord
lord said her two nations thy womb manner people separated bowels one stronger than other elder serve younger
her days delivered fulfilled behold there twins womb
first came out red over like hairy garment called name esau
after came brother out hand took hold on esau's heel name called jacob isaac threescore years old she bare
boys grew esau cunning hunter man field jacob plain dwelling tents
isaac loved esau because did eat venison rebekah jacob
jacob sod pottage esau came field faint
esau said jacob feed pray thee same red pottage am faint therefore name called edom
jacob said sell day thy birthright
esau said behold am at point die what profit birthright do
jacob said swear day sware sold birthright
then jacob gave esau bread pottage lentiles did eat drink rose went way thus despised birthright
there famine land beside first days abraham isaac went abimelech king philistines gerar
lord appeared said go down egypt dwell land tell thee

because abraham obeyed voice kept charge commandments statutes laws

abimelech said what thou hast done us one people might lightly lien thy wife shouldest brought guiltiness upon
abimelech charged people saying toucheth man or wife surely put death
then isaac sowed land received same year hundredfold lord blessed
man waxed great went forward grew until became very
had possession flocks herds great store servants philistines envied

called shebah therefore name city beersheba day

grief mind isaac rebekah

said behold now am old know day death
now therefore take pray thee thy weapons quiver bow go out field some venison
make savoury meat such love bring may eat soul bless thee before die

bring venison make savoury meat may eat bless thee before lord death
now therefore son obey voice according command thee
go now flock fetch thence two good kids goats make savoury meat thy father such loveth
thou shalt bring thy father may eat bless thee before death

father peradventure feel seem deceiver bring curse upon blessing
mother said upon thy curse son only obey voice go fetch
went fetched brought mother made savoury meat such father loved

she put skins kids goats upon hands smooth neck
she gave savoury meat bread had prepared hand her son jacob
came father said here am who art thou son

therefore god give thee dew heaven fatness earth plenty corn wine

also had made savoury meat brought father said let arise eat son's venison thy soul may bless

said thy brother came subtilty hath taken away blessing

by thy sword shalt thou live serve brother come pass dominion break yoke off neck

called name place bethel city luz at first

so come again father's house peace then lord god
stone set pillar god's house thou shalt give surely tenth thee
then jacob went on journey came land people east
looked behold well field lo there three flocks sheep lying by out watered great stone upon well's mouth
thither flocks gathered rolled stone well's mouth watered sheep put again upon place
jacob said brethren whence ye haran we
said know ye laban son nahor we
said well behold rachel daughter cometh sheep
said lo yet high day neither time cattle should gathered together water ye sheep go feed

while yet spake rachel came her father's sheep she kept

came pass laban heard tidings jacob sister's son ran meet embraced kissed brought house told these things

laban had two daughters name elder leah younger rachel
leah tender eyed rachel beautiful well favoured
jacob loved rachel said serve thee seven years thy younger daughter
laban said better give her thee than should another man abide

came pass evening took leah daughter brought her went

jacob did so fulfilled her week gave rachel daughter wife also

lord saw leah hated opened her womb rachel barren

she conceived again bare son said because lord hath heard hated therefore given also called name simeon
she conceived again bare son said now time husband joined because born three sons therefore name called levi
she conceived again bare son said now praise lord therefore called name judah left bearing

she said her small matter thou hast taken husband wouldest take away son's mandrakes also rachel therefore lie thee night thy

she conceived bare son said god hath taken away reproach
she called name joseph said lord add another son
came pass rachel had born joseph jacob said laban send away may go mine own place country
give wives children whom served thee let go thou knowest service done
laban said pray thee if found favour thine eyes tarry learned by experience lord hath blessed thy sake
said appoint thy wages give
said thou knowest how served thee thy cattle
little thou hadst before came now increased multitude lord hath blessed thee since coming provide mine own house also
said what give thee jacob thou shalt any thing if wilt do again feed keep thy flock
pass through thy flock day removing thence speckled spotted cattle brown among sheep goats such hire
so righteousness answer time come hire before thy face every one speckled spotted among goats brown sheep counted stolen
laban said behold would might according thy word
removed day goats ringstraked spotted she speckled every one had some white brown among sheep gave hand sons
set three days' journey betwixt himself jacob fed rest laban's flocks
jacob took rods green poplar hazel chesnut tree pilled white strakes made appear
set rods had pilled before flocks gutters watering troughs came drink should conceive

came pass whensoever stronger cattle did conceive jacob laid rods before eyes gutters might among

said see your father's countenance toward before god father hath been
ye know power served your father

thus god hath taken away cattle your father given
came pass at time cattle conceived lifted mine eyes saw dream behold rams leaped upon ringstraked speckled grisled

then jacob rose set sons wives upon camels
carried away cattle goods had gotten getting padanaram go isaac father land canaan
laban went shear sheep rachel had stolen images her father's
jacob stole away unawares laban syrian told fled
so fled had rose passed over river set face toward mount gilead
told laban on third day jacob fled
took brethren pursued after seven days' journey overtook mount gilead
god came laban syrian dream by night said take heed thou speak jacob either good or bad
then laban overtook jacob now had pitched tent mount brethren gilead
laban said jacob what hast thou done stolen away unawares carried daughters captives taken sword
wherefore didst thou flee away secretly steal tell might sent thee mirth songs tabret harp
hast suffered kiss sons daughters thou now done foolishly so doing
power hand do you hurt god your father spake yesternight saying take thou heed speak jacob either good or bad
now though thou wouldest needs gone because sore longedst after thy father's house yet wherefore hast stolen gods
jacob answered said laban because afraid peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy daughters
whomsoever thou findest thy gods let live before our brethren discern what thine take thee jacob knew rachel had stolen
laban went jacob's tent leah's two maidservants' tents found then out entered rachel's
now rachel had taken images put camel's furniture sat upon laban searched tent found
she said her father let displease lord cannot rise before thee custom women upon searched found images
jacob wroth chode laban answered said what trespass sin thou hast so hotly pursued after
whereas thou hast searched stuff what found thy household set here before brethren may judge betwixt us both
twenty years been thee thy ewes she goats cast young rams flock eaten
torn beasts brought thee bare loss hand didst thou require whether stolen by day or night
thus day drought consumed frost by night sleep departed mine eyes
thus been twenty years thy house served thee fourteen two daughters six cattle thou hast changed wages ten times
except god father abraham fear isaac had been surely thou hadst sent away now empty hath seen mine affliction labour hands rebuked thee yesternight
laban answered said jacob these daughters children cattle thou seest mine what can do day or born
now therefore come thou let us make covenant witness between thee
jacob took stone set pillar
jacob said brethren gather stones took made heap did eat there upon
laban called jegarsahadutha jacob galeed
laban said heap witness between thee day therefore name called galeed
mizpah said lord watch between thee we absent one another
if thou shalt afflict daughters or take other wives beside no man us see god witness betwixt thee
laban said jacob behold heap pillar cast betwixt thee
heap witness pillar pass over thee thou shalt harm
god abraham nahor father judge betwixt us jacob sware by fear isaac
then jacob offered sacrifice upon mount called brethren eat bread did tarried night
early morning laban rose kissed sons daughters blessed departed returned place
jacob went on way angels god met
jacob saw said god's host called name place mahanaim
jacob sent messengers before esau brother land seir country edom
commanded saying thus ye speak lord esau thy servant jacob saith sojourned laban stayed there until now
oxen asses flocks menservants womenservants sent tell lord may find grace thy sight
messengers returned jacob saying we came thy brother esau also cometh meet thee four hundred men
then jacob greatly afraid distressed divided people flocks herds camels two bands
said if esau come one company smite then other left escape
jacob said o god father abraham isaac lord saidst return thy country kindred deal well thee
am worthy least mercies truth thou hast shewed thy servant staff passed over jordan now become two bands
deliver pray thee hand brother esau fear lest come smite mother children
thou saidst surely do thee good make thy seed sand sea cannot numbered multitude
lodged there same night took came hand present esau brother
two hundred she goats twenty ewes rams
thirty milch camels colts forty kine ten bulls twenty she asses foals

lord asked servants saying ye father or brother

now therefore grieved nor angry yourselves ye sold hither god did send before you preserve life
these two years hath famine been land yet there five neither earing nor harvest
god sent before you preserve posterity earth save your lives by great deliverance
so now you sent hither god hath made father pharaoh lord house ruler throughout land egypt

pass through land egypt night smite firstborn both man beast against gods execute judgment am lord
blood you token upon houses where ye see pass over plague destroy smite land egypt
day you memorial ye keep feast lord throughout your generations by ordinance ever
seven days ye eat unleavened bread even first day put away leaven out your houses whosoever eateth leavened until seventh soul cut off israel
first day there holy convocation seventh you no manner work done save every man must eat only may
ye observe feast unleavened bread selfsame day brought your armies out land egypt therefore generations by ordinance ever
first month on fourteenth day at even ye eat unleavened bread until one twentieth
seven days there no leaven found your houses whosoever eateth leavened even soul cut off congregation israel whether stranger or born land
ye eat nothing leavened your habitations unleavened bread
then moses called elders israel said draw out take you lamb according your families kill passover
ye take bunch hyssop dip blood bason strike lintel two side posts none you go out at door house until morning
lord pass through smite egyptians seeth blood upon lintel on two side posts over door suffer destroyer come your houses you
ye observe thing ordinance thee thy sons ever
come pass ye land lord give you according hath promised keep service
come pass your children say you what mean ye by service
ye say sacrifice lord's passover who passed over houses children israel egypt smote egyptians delivered our people bowed head worshipped
children israel went away did lord had commanded moses aaron so
came pass at midnight lord smote firstborn land egypt pharaoh sat on throne captive dungeon cattle
pharaoh rose night servants egyptians there great cry egypt house where one dead
called moses aaron by night said rise get you forth among people both ye children israel go serve lord
also take your flocks herds ye said gone bless
egyptians urgent upon people might send out land haste said we dead men
people took dough before leavened kneadingtroughs being bound clothes upon shoulders

lord gave people favour sight egyptians so lent such things required spoiled
children israel journeyed rameses succoth about six hundred thousand on foot men beside
mixed multitude went also flocks herds even very much cattle
baked unleavened cakes dough brought forth out egypt leavened because thrust could tarry neither had prepared themselves any victual
now sojourning children israel who dwelt egypt four hundred thirty years
came pass at end four hundred thirty years even selfsame day hosts lord went out land egypt
night much observed lord bringing out land egypt children israel generations
lord said moses aaron ordinance passover there no stranger eat thereof
every man's servant bought money thou hast circumcised then eat thereof
foreigner hired servant eat thereof

congregation israel keep
stranger sojourn thee keep passover lord let males circumcised then come near one born land no uncircumcised person eat thereof
one law homeborn stranger sojourneth among you
thus did children israel lord commanded moses aaron so
came pass selfsame day lord did bring children israel out land egypt by armies
lord spake moses saying
sanctify firstborn whatsoever openeth womb among children israel both man beast mine
moses said people remember day ye came out egypt house bondage by strength hand lord brought you place there no leavened bread eaten
day came ye out month abib
lord bring thee land canaanites hittites amorites hivites jebusites sware thy fathers give flowing milk honey thou shalt keep service month

unleavened bread eaten seven days there no leavened seen thee neither leaven thy quarters
thou shalt shew thy son day saying done because lord did came forth out egypt
sign thee upon thine hand memorial between eyes lord's law may thy mouth strong hath lord brought out egypt
thou shalt therefore keep ordinance season year
lord bring thee land canaanites sware thy fathers give
thou shalt set apart lord openeth matrix every firstling cometh beast hast males lord's
every firstling ass thou shalt redeem lamb if wilt then break neck firstborn man among thy children
thy son asketh thee time come saying what thou shalt say by strength hand lord brought us out egypt house bondage
came pass pharaoh would hardly let us go lord slew firstborn land egypt both man beast therefore sacrifice openeth matrix being males children redeem
token upon thine hand frontlets between eyes by strength lord brought us forth out egypt

told king egypt people fled heart pharaoh servants turned against said why we done let israel go serving us
made ready chariot took people
took six hundred chosen chariots egypt captains over every one

word we did tell thee egypt saying let us alone may serve egyptians had been better than should die wilderness

lord fight you ye hold your peace

thy right hand o lord become glorious power hath dashed pieces enemy
greatness thine excellency thou hast overthrown rose against thee sentest forth thy wrath consumed stubble
blast thy nostrils waters gathered together floods stood upright heap depths congealed heart sea
enemy said pursue overtake divide spoil lust satisfied upon draw sword hand destroy

came pass on morrow moses sat judge people stood by morning evening
moses' father law saw did people said what thing thou doest why sittest thyself alone stand by thee morning even
moses said father law because people come enquire god
matter come judge between one another do make know statutes god laws
moses' father law said thing thou doest good
thou wilt surely wear away both people thee thing too heavy art able perform thyself alone
hearken now voice give thee counsel god thou people godward mayest bring causes
thou shalt teach ordinances laws shew way wherein must walk work do
moreover thou shalt provide out people able men such fear god truth hating covetousness place over rulers thousands hundreds fifties tens
let judge people at seasons every great matter bring thee small so easier thyself bear burden
if thou shalt do thing god command thee so then able endure people also go place peace
so moses hearkened voice father law did had said
moses chose able men out israel made heads over people rulers thousands hundreds fifties tens
judged people at seasons hard causes brought moses every small matter themselves
moses let father law depart went way own land

ye seen what did egyptians how bare you on eagles' wings brought myself
now therefore if ye obey voice indeed keep covenant then peculiar treasure above people earth mine
ye kingdom priests holy nation these words thou shalt speak children israel
moses came called elders people laid before faces these words lord commanded
people answered together said lord hath spoken we do moses returned words
lord said moses lo come thee thick cloud people may hear speak believe ever told words
lord said moses go people sanctify day morrow let wash clothes
ready against third day lord come down sight people upon mount sinai
thou shalt set bounds people round about saying take heed yourselves ye go mount or touch border whosoever toucheth surely put death
there hand touch surely stoned or shot through whether beast man live trumpet soundeth long come mount

said people ready against third day come at your wives

lord came down upon mount sinai on top called moses went

so moses went down people spake
god spake these words saying
am lord thy god brought thee out land egypt house bondage
thou shalt no other gods before
thou shalt make thee any graven image or likeness thing heaven above earth beneath water under
thou shalt bow down thyself nor serve lord thy god am jealous visiting iniquity fathers upon children third fourth generation hate
shewing mercy thousands love keep commandments
thou shalt take name lord thy god vain hold guiltless taketh
remember sabbath day keep holy
six days shalt thou labour do thy work
seventh day sabbath lord thy god thou shalt do any work nor son daughter manservant maidservant cattle stranger within gates
six days lord made heaven earth sea rested seventh day wherefore blessed sabbath hallowed
honour thy father mother days may long upon land lord god giveth thee
thou shalt kill
thou shalt commit adultery
thou shalt steal
thou shalt bear false witness against thy neighbour
thou shalt covet thy neighbour's house wife nor manservant maidservant ox ass any thing
people saw thunderings lightnings noise trumpet mountain smoking removed stood afar off
said moses speak thou us we hear let god lest die
moses said people fear god come prove you may before your faces ye sin
people stood afar off moses drew near thick darkness where god
lord said moses thus thou shalt say children israel ye seen talked you heaven
ye make gods silver neither you gold
altar earth thou shalt make sacrifice thereon thy burnt offerings peace sheep thine oxen places where record name come thee bless
if thou wilt make altar stone shalt build hewn lift thy tool upon hast polluted
neither shalt thou go by steps mine altar thy nakedness discovered thereon
now these judgments thou shalt set before
if thou buy hebrew servant six years serve seventh go out free nothing
if came by himself go out married then wife
if master given wife she born sons or daughters her children master's go out by himself
if servant plainly say love master wife children go out free
then master bring judges also door or post bore ear through aul serve ever
if man sell daughter maidservant she go out menservants do
if she please her master who hath betrothed himself then let redeemed sell strange nation no power seeing dealt deceitfully
if betrothed her son deal after manner daughters
if take another wife her food raiment duty marriage diminish
if do these three her then she go out free without money
smiteth man so die surely put death
if man lie wait god deliver hand then appoint thee place whither flee
if man come presumptuously upon neighbour slay guile thou shalt take mine altar may die
smiteth father or mother surely put death
stealeth man selleth or if found hand surely put death
curseth father or mother surely put death
if men strive together one smite another stone or fist die keepeth bed
if rise again walk abroad upon staff then smote quit only pay loss time cause thoroughly healed
if man smite servant or maid rod die under hand surely punished
notwithstanding if continue day or two punished money
if men strive hurt woman child so her fruit depart yet no mischief follow surely punished according woman's husband lay upon pay judges determine
if any mischief follow then thou shalt give life
eye tooth hand foot
burning wound stripe
if man smite eye servant or maid perish let go free eye's sake
if smite out manservant's tooth or maidservant's let go free tooth's sake
if ox gore man or woman die then surely stoned flesh eaten owner quit
if ox wont push horn time past hath been testified owner kept killed man or woman stoned also put death
if there laid on sum money then give ransom life whatsoever upon
whether gored son or daughter according judgment done
if ox push manservant or maidservant give master thirty shekels silver stoned
if man open pit or dig cover ox ass fall therein
owner pit make good give money dead beast
if one man's ox hurt another's die then sell live divide money dead also
or if known ox hath used push time past owner kept surely pay dead own
if man steal ox or sheep kill sell restore five oxen four
if thief found breaking smitten die there no blood shed
if sun risen upon there blood shed should make full restitution nothing then sold theft
if theft certainly found hand alive whether ox or ass sheep restore double
if man cause field or vineyard eaten put beast feed another man's best own make restitution
if fire break out catch thorns so stacks corn or standing field consumed therewith kindled surely make restitution
if man deliver neighbour money or stuff keep stolen out man's house thief found let pay double
if thief found then master house brought judges see whether put hand neighbour's goods
manner trespass whether ox ass sheep raiment or any lost thing another challengeth cause both parties come before judges whom condemn pay double neighbour
if man deliver neighbour ass or ox sheep any beast keep die hurt driven away no seeing
then oath lord between both hath put hand neighbour's goods owner accept thereof make good
if stolen make restitution owner thereof
if torn pieces then let bring witness make good
if man borrow ought neighbour hurt or die owner thereof being surely make good
if owner thereof make good hired thing came hire
if man entice maid betrothed lie her surely endow wife
if her father utterly refuse give pay money according dowry virgins
thou shalt suffer witch live
whosoever lieth beast surely put death
sacrificeth any god save lord only utterly destroyed
thou shalt neither vex stranger nor oppress ye strangers land egypt
ye afflict any widow or fatherless child
if thou afflict any wise cry at surely hear
wrath wax hot kill you sword your wives widows children fatherless
if thou lend money any people poor by thee shalt usurer neither lay upon usury
if thou at take thy neighbour's raiment pledge shalt deliver by sun goeth down
covering only raiment skin wherein sleep come pass crieth hear am gracious
thou shalt revile gods nor curse ruler thy people
thou shalt delay offer first thy ripe fruits liquors firstborn sons give
likewise shalt thou do thine oxen thy sheep seven days dam on eighth day give
ye holy men neither eat any flesh torn beasts field cast dogs
thou shalt raise false report put thine hand wicked unrighteous witness
thou shalt follow multitude do evil neither speak cause decline after many wrest judgment
neither shalt thou countenance poor man cause
if thou meet thine enemy's ox or ass going astray shalt surely bring back again
if thou see ass hateth thee lying under burden wouldest forbear help shalt surely
thou shalt wrest judgment thy poor cause
keep thee far false matter innocent righteous slay thou justify wicked
thou shalt take no gift blindeth wise perverteth words righteous
also thou shalt oppress stranger ye know heart seeing strangers land egypt
six years thou shalt sow thy land gather fruits thereof
seventh year thou shalt let rest lie still poor thy people may eat what leave beasts field like manner deal vineyard oliveyard
six days thou shalt do thy work on seventh day rest thine ox ass may son handmaid stranger refreshed
things said you circumspect make no mention name other gods neither let heard out thy mouth
three times thou shalt keep feast year
thou shalt keep feast unleavened bread eat seven days commanded thee time appointed month abib camest out egypt none appear before empty
feast harvest firstfruits thy labours thou hast sown field ingathering end year gathered out
three times year thy males appear before lord god
thou shalt offer blood sacrifice leavened bread neither fat remain until morning
first firstfruits thy land thou shalt bring house lord god seethe kid mother's milk
behold send angel before thee keep way bring place prepared
beware obey voice provoke pardon your transgressions name
if thou shalt indeed obey voice do speak then enemy thine enemies adversary adversaries
mine angel go before thee bring amorites hittites perizzites canaanites hivites jebusites cut off
thou shalt bow down gods nor serve do after works utterly overthrow quite break images
ye serve lord your god bless thy bread water take sickness away midst thee
there nothing cast young nor barren thy land number days fulfil
send fear before thee destroy people whom thou shalt come make thine enemies turn backs
send hornets before thee drive out hivite canaanite hittite
drive out before thee one year lest land become desolate beast field multiply against
by little drive out before thee until thou increased inherit land
set thy bounds red sea even philistines desert river deliver inhabitants land your hand thou shalt drive out before thee
thou shalt make no covenant nor gods

if soul sin hear voice swearing witness whether hath seen or known do utter then bear iniquity
or if soul touch any unclean thing whether carcase beast cattle creeping things hidden also guilty

or if soul swear pronouncing lips do evil good whatsoever man pronounce oath hid knoweth then guilty one these

lord spake moses saying
if soul commit trespass sin through ignorance holy things lord then bring ram without blemish out flocks thy estimation by shekels silver after shekel sanctuary offering
make amends harm hath done holy thing add fifth part thereto give priest atonement ram trespass offering forgiven
if soul sin commit any these things forbidden done by commandments lord though wist yet guilty bear iniquity
bring ram without blemish out flock thy estimation trespass offering priest make atonement concerning ignorance wherein erred wist forgiven
trespass offering hath certainly trespassed against lord
lord spake moses saying
if soul sin commit trespass against lord lie neighbour delivered keep or fellowship thing taken away by violence hath deceived
or found lost lieth concerning sweareth falsely any these man doeth sinning therein
then because hath sinned guilty restore took violently away or thing deceitfully gotten delivered keep lost found
or about hath sworn falsely even restore principal add fifth part more thereto give whom appertaineth day trespass offering

lord spake moses saying
speak children israel saying ye eat no manner fat ox or sheep goat
fat beast dieth itself torn beasts may used any other use ye no wise eat
whosoever eateth fat beast men offer offering made by fire lord even soul cut off people
moreover ye eat no manner blood whether fowl or beast any your dwellings
whatsoever soul eateth any manner blood even cut off people

lord spake moses aaron saying
speak children israel saying these beasts ye eat among on earth
whatsoever parteth hoof clovenfooted cheweth cud among beasts ye eat
nevertheless these ye eat chew cud or divide hoof camel because cheweth divideth unclean you
coney because cheweth cud divideth hoof unclean you
hare because cheweth cud divideth hoof unclean you
swine though divide hoof clovenfooted yet cheweth cud unclean you
flesh ye eat carcase touch unclean you
these ye eat waters whatsoever hath fins scales seas rivers
fins scales seas rivers move waters any living thing abomination you
even abomination you ye eat flesh carcases
whatsoever hath no fins nor scales waters abomination you
these ye abomination among fowls eaten eagle ossifrage ospray
vulture kite after kind
every raven after kind
owl night hawk cuckow after kind
little owl cormorant great
swan pelican gier eagle
stork heron after her kind lapwing bat
fowls creep going upon four abomination you
yet these may ye eat every flying creeping thing goeth upon four legs above feet leap withal earth
even these ye may eat locust after kind bald beetle grasshopper
other flying creeping things four feet abomination you
these ye unclean whosoever toucheth carcase until even
whosoever beareth ought carcase wash clothes unclean until even
carcases every beast divideth hoof clovenfooted nor cheweth cud unclean you one toucheth
whatsoever goeth upon paws among manner beasts go on four those unclean you whoso toucheth carcase until even
beareth carcase wash clothes unclean until even you
these also unclean you among creeping things creep upon earth weasel mouse tortoise after kind
ferret chameleon lizard snail mole
these unclean you among creep whosoever doth touch dead until even
upon whatsoever any dead doth fall unclean whether vessel wood or raiment skin sack wherein work done must put water until even so cleansed
every earthen vessel whereinto any falleth whatsoever unclean ye break
meat may eaten on such water cometh unclean drink drunk every vessel
every thing whereupon any part carcase falleth unclean whether oven or ranges pots broken down you
nevertheless fountain or pit wherein there plenty water clean toucheth carcase unclean
if any part carcase fall upon sowing seed sown clean
if any water put upon seed part carcase fall thereon unclean you
if any beast ye may eat die toucheth carcase thereof unclean until even
eateth carcase wash clothes unclean until even also beareth
every creeping thing creepeth upon earth abomination eaten
whatsoever goeth upon belly four or hath more feet among creeping things creep earth ye eat abomination
ye make yourselves abominable any creeping thing creepeth neither unclean should defiled thereby
am lord your god ye therefore sanctify yourselves holy neither defile any manner creeping thing creepeth upon earth
am lord bringeth you out land egypt your god ye therefore holy
law beasts fowl every living creature moveth waters creepeth upon earth
make difference between unclean clean beast may eaten
lord spake moses saying
speak children israel saying if woman conceived seed born man child then she unclean seven days according separation her infirmity
eighth day flesh foreskin circumcised
she then continue blood her purifying three thirty days touch no hallowed thing nor come sanctuary until fulfilled
if she bear maid child then unclean two weeks her separation continue blood purifying threescore six days
days her purifying fulfilled son or daughter she bring lamb first year burnt offering young pigeon turtledove sin door tabernacle congregation priest
who offer before lord make atonement her she cleansed issue blood law hath born male or female
if she able bring lamb then two turtles or young pigeons one burnt offering other sin priest make atonement her clean
lord spake moses aaron saying
man skin flesh rising scab or bright spot like plague leprosy then brought aaron priest one sons priests
priest look on plague skin flesh hair turned white sight deeper than leprosy pronounce unclean
if bright spot white skin flesh sight deeper than hair thereof turned then priest shut hath plague seven days
priest look on seventh day behold if plague sight at stay spread skin then shut seven days more
priest look on again seventh day behold if plague somewhat dark spread skin pronounce clean scab wash clothes
if scab spread much abroad skin after hath been seen priest cleansing again
if priest see behold scab spreadeth skin then pronounce unclean leprosy
plague leprosy man then brought priest
priest see behold if rising white skin turned hair there quick raw flesh
old leprosy skin flesh priest pronounce unclean shut
if leprosy break out abroad skin cover hath plague head even foot wheresoever priest looketh
then priest consider behold if leprosy covered flesh pronounce clean hath plague turned white
raw flesh appeareth unclean
priest see raw flesh pronounce unclean leprosy
or if raw flesh turn again changed white come priest
priest see behold if plague turned white then pronounce clean hath
flesh also even skin thereof boil healed
place boil there white rising or bright spot somewhat reddish shewed priest
if priest seeth behold sight lower than skin hair thereof turned white pronounce unclean plague leprosy broken out boil
if priest look on behold there no white hairs therein lower than skin somewhat dark then shut seven days
if spread much abroad skin then priest pronounce unclean plague
if bright spot stay place spread burning boil priest pronounce clean
or if there any flesh skin whereof hot burning quick burneth white bright spot somewhat reddish
then priest look upon behold if hair bright spot turned white sight deeper than skin leprosy broken out burning wherefore pronounce unclean plague
if priest look on behold there no white hair bright spot lower than other skin somewhat dark then shut seven days
priest look upon seventh day if spread much abroad skin then pronounce unclean plague leprosy
if bright spot stay place spread skin somewhat dark rising burning priest pronounce clean inflammation
if man or woman plague upon head beard
then priest see plague behold if sight deeper than skin there yellow thin hair pronounce unclean dry scall even leprosy upon head or beard
if priest look on plague scall behold sight deeper than skin there no black hair then shut hath seven days
seventh day priest look on plague behold if scall spread there no yellow hair sight deeper than skin
shaven scall shave priest shut hath seven days more
seventh day priest look on scall behold if spread skin nor sight deeper than then pronounce clean wash clothes
if scall spread much skin after cleansing
then priest look on behold if scall spread skin seek yellow hair unclean
if scall sight at stay there black hair grown therein healed clean priest pronounce
if man also or woman skin flesh bright spots even white
then priest look behold if bright spots skin flesh darkish white freckled spot groweth clean
man whose hair fallen off head bald yet clean
hath hair fallen off part head toward face forehead bald yet clean
if there bald head or forehead white reddish sore leprosy sprung
then priest look upon behold if rising sore white reddish bald head or forehead leprosy appeareth skin flesh
leprous man unclean priest pronounce utterly plague head
leper whom plague clothes rent head bare put covering upon upper lip cry unclean
days wherein plague defiled unclean dwell alone without camp habitation
garment also plague leprosy whether woollen or linen
whether warp or woof linen woollen skin any thing made
if plague greenish or reddish garment skin either warp woof any thing leprosy shewed priest
priest look upon plague shut hath seven days
look on plague seventh day if spread garment either warp or woof skin any work made fretting leprosy unclean
therefore burn garment whether warp or woof woollen linen any thing skin wherein plague fretting leprosy burnt fire
if priest look behold plague spread garment either warp or woof any thing skin
then priest command wash thing wherein plague shut seven days more
priest look on plague after washed behold if changed colour spread unclean thou shalt burn fire fret inward whether bare within or without
if priest look behold plague somewhat dark after washing then rend out garment or skin warp woof
if appear still garment either warp or woof any thing skin spreading plague thou shalt burn wherein fire
garment either warp or woof whatsoever thing skin thou shalt wash if plague departed then washed second time clean
law plague leprosy garment woollen or linen either warp woof any thing skins pronounce clean unclean

lord spake moses aaron saying
ye come land canaan give you possession put plague leprosy house your
owneth house come tell priest saying seemeth there plague
then priest command empty house before go see plague made unclean afterward
look on plague behold if walls house hollow strakes greenish or reddish sight lower than wall
then priest go out house door shut seven days
priest come again seventh day look behold if plague spread walls house
then priest command take away stones plague cast unclean place without city
cause house scraped within round about pour out dust scrape off without city unclean place
take other stones put place those morter plaister house
if plague come again break out house after hath taken away stones scraped plaistered
then priest come look behold if plague spread house fretting leprosy unclean
break down house stones timber thereof morter carry forth out city unclean place
moreover goeth house while shut unclean until even
lieth house wash clothes eateth
if priest come look upon behold plague hath spread house after plaistered then pronounce clean because healed
take cleanse house two birds cedar wood scarlet hyssop
kill one birds earthen vessel over running water
take cedar wood hyssop scarlet living bird dip blood slain running water sprinkle house seven times
cleanse house blood bird running water living cedar wood hyssop scarlet
let go living bird out city open fields make atonement house clean
law manner plague leprosy scall
leprosy garment house
rising scab bright spot
teach unclean clean law leprosy
lord spake moses aaron saying
speak children israel say any man hath running issue out flesh because unclean
uncleanness issue whether flesh run or stopped
every bed whereon lieth hath issue unclean thing sitteth
whosoever toucheth bed wash clothes bathe himself water unclean until even
sitteth on any thing whereon sat hath issue wash clothes bathe himself water unclean until even
toucheth flesh hath issue wash clothes bathe himself water unclean until even
if hath issue spit upon clean then wash clothes bathe himself water unclean until even
what saddle soever rideth upon hath issue unclean
whosoever toucheth any thing under unclean until even beareth those things wash clothes bathe himself water
whomsoever toucheth hath issue rinsed hands water wash clothes bathe himself unclean until even
vessel earth toucheth hath issue broken every wood rinsed water
hath issue cleansed then number himself seven days cleansing wash clothes bathe flesh running water clean
on eighth day take two turtledoves or young pigeons come before lord door tabernacle congregation give priest
priest offer one sin offering other burnt make atonement before lord issue
if any man's seed copulation go out then wash flesh water unclean until even
every garment skin whereon seed copulation washed water unclean until even
woman also whom man lie seed copulation both bathe themselves water unclean until even
if woman issue her flesh blood she put apart seven days whosoever toucheth unclean until even
every thing she lieth upon her separation unclean also sitteth
whosoever toucheth her bed wash clothes bathe himself water unclean until even
whosoever toucheth any thing she sat upon wash clothes bathe himself water unclean until even
if on her bed or any thing whereon she sitteth toucheth unclean until even
if any man lie her at flowers upon unclean seven days bed whereon lieth
if woman issue her blood many days out time separation or run beyond uncleanness she unclean
every bed whereon she lieth days her issue separation whatsoever sitteth upon unclean uncleanness
whosoever toucheth those things unclean wash clothes bathe himself water until even
if she cleansed her issue then number herself seven days after clean
on eighth day she take her two turtles or young pigeons bring priest door tabernacle congregation
priest offer one sin offering other burnt make atonement her before lord issue uncleanness
thus ye separate children israel uncleanness die defile tabernacle among
law hath issue whose seed goeth defiled therewith
her sick flowers hath issue man woman lieth unclean
lord spake moses after death two sons aaron offered before died
lord said moses speak aaron thy brother come at times holy place within vail before mercy seat upon ark die appear cloud
thus aaron come holy place young bullock sin offering ram burnt
put on holy linen coat breeches upon flesh girded girdle mitre attired these garments therefore wash water so
take congregation children israel two kids goats sin offering one ram burnt
aaron offer bullock sin offering himself make atonement house
take two goats present before lord at door tabernacle congregation
aaron cast lots upon two goats one lot lord other scapegoat
aaron bring goat upon lord's lot fell offer sin offering
goat on lot fell scapegoat presented alive before lord make atonement let go wilderness
aaron bring bullock sin offering himself make atonement house kill
take censer full burning coals fire off altar before lord hands sweet incense beaten small bring within vail
put incense upon fire before lord cloud may cover mercy seat testimony die

then kill goat sin offering people bring blood within vail do did bullock sprinkle upon mercy seat before
make atonement holy place because uncleanness children israel transgressions sins so do tabernacle congregation remaineth among midst
there no man tabernacle congregation goeth make atonement holy place until come out made himself household israel

sprinkle blood upon finger seven times cleanse hallow uncleanness children israel

lord spake moses saying
speak aaron sons children israel say thing lord hath commanded saying

no more offer sacrifices devils after whom gone whoring statute ever throughout generations
thou shalt say whatsoever man there house israel or strangers sojourn among you offereth burnt offering sacrifice
bringeth door tabernacle congregation offer lord even man cut off among people
whatsoever man there house israel or strangers sojourn among you eateth any manner blood even set face against soul cut off people
life flesh blood given you upon altar make atonement your souls maketh soul
therefore said children israel no soul you eat blood neither any stranger sojourneth among
whatsoever man there children israel or strangers sojourn among you hunteth catcheth any beast fowl may eaten even pour out blood thereof cover dust
life flesh blood thereof therefore said children israel ye eat no manner whosoever eateth cut off

if wash nor bathe flesh then bear iniquity
lord spake moses saying
speak children israel say am lord your god
after doings land egypt wherein ye dwelt do canaan whither bring you neither walk ordinances
ye do judgments keep mine ordinances walk therein am lord your god
ye therefore keep statutes judgments if man do live am lord
none you approach any near kin uncover nakedness am lord
nakedness thy father or mother shalt thou uncover she her
nakedness thy father's wife shalt thou uncover
nakedness thy sister daughter father or mother whether she born at home abroad even thou shalt uncover
nakedness thy son's daughter or daughter's even thou shalt uncover their's thine own
nakedness thy father's wife's daughter begotten father she sister thou shalt uncover her
thou shalt uncover nakedness thy father's sister she near kinswoman
thou shalt uncover nakedness thy mother's sister she near kinswoman
thou shalt uncover nakedness thy father's brother approach wife she thine aunt
thou shalt uncover nakedness thy daughter law she son's wife her
thou shalt uncover nakedness thy brother's wife
thou shalt uncover nakedness woman her daughter neither take son's or daughter's near kinswomen wickedness
neither shalt thou take wife her sister vex uncover nakedness beside other life time
also thou shalt approach woman uncover her nakedness long she put apart uncleanness
moreover thou shalt lie carnally thy neighbour's wife defile thyself her
thou shalt let any thy seed pass through fire molech neither profane name god am lord
thou shalt lie mankind womankind abomination
neither shalt thou lie any beast defile thyself therewith woman stand before down thereto confusion
defile ye yourselves any these things nations defiled cast out before you
land defiled therefore do visit iniquity thereof upon itself vomiteth out her inhabitants
ye therefore keep statutes judgments commit any these abominations neither your own nation nor stranger sojourneth among you
these abominations men land done before you defiled
land spue you out also ye defile spued nations before
whosoever commit any these abominations even souls cut off among people
therefore ye keep mine ordinance commit any one these abominable customs committed before you defile yourselves therein am lord your god
lord spake moses saying
speak congregation children israel say ye holy lord your god am
ye fear every man mother father keep sabbaths am lord your god
turn ye idols nor make yourselves molten gods am lord your god
if ye offer sacrifice peace offerings lord at your own
eaten same day ye offer on morrow if ought remain until third burnt fire
if eaten at on third day abominable accepted
therefore every one eateth bear iniquity because hath profaned hallowed thing lord soul cut off among people
ye reap harvest your land thou shalt wholly corners thy field neither gather gleanings
thou shalt glean thy vineyard neither gather every grape leave poor stranger am lord your god
ye steal neither deal falsely lie one another
ye swear by name falsely neither shalt thou profane thy god am lord
thou shalt defraud thy neighbour neither rob wages hired abide thee night until morning
thou shalt curse deaf nor put stumblingblock before blind fear thy god am lord
ye do no unrighteousness judgment thou shalt respect person poor nor honour mighty righteousness judge thy neighbour
thou shalt go down talebearer among thy people neither stand against blood neighbour am lord
thou shalt hate thy brother thine heart any wise rebuke neighbour suffer sin upon
thou shalt avenge nor bear any grudge against children thy people love neighbour thyself am lord
ye keep statutes thou shalt let thy cattle gender diverse kind sow field mingled seed neither garment linen woollen come upon thee
whosoever lieth carnally woman bondmaid betrothed husband at redeemed nor freedom given her she scourged put death because free
bring trespass offering lord door tabernacle congregation even ram
priest make atonement ram trespass offering before lord sin hath done forgiven
ye come land planted manner trees food then count fruit thereof uncircumcised three years you eaten
fourth year fruit thereof holy praise lord withal
fifth year ye eat fruit thereof may yield you increase am lord your god
ye eat any thing blood neither use enchantment nor observe times
ye round corners your heads neither shalt thou mar thy beard
ye make any cuttings your flesh dead nor print marks upon you am lord
do prostitute thy daughter cause her whore lest land fall whoredom become full wickedness
ye keep sabbaths reverence sanctuary am lord
regard familiar spirits neither seek after wizards defiled by am lord your god
thou shalt rise before hoary head honour face old man fear thy god am lord
if stranger sojourn thee your land ye vex
stranger dwelleth you one born among thou shalt love thyself ye strangers land egypt am lord your god
ye do no unrighteousness judgment meteyard weight or measure
just balances weights ephah hin ye am lord your god brought you out land egypt
therefore ye observe statutes judgments do am lord

soul turneth after such familiar spirits wizards go whoring even set face against cut off among people
sanctify yourselves therefore ye holy am lord your god
ye keep statutes do am lord sanctify you
every one curseth father or mother surely put death hath cursed blood upon
man committeth adultery another man's wife even neighbour's adulterer adulteress surely put death
man lieth father's wife hath uncovered nakedness both surely put death blood upon
if man lie daughter law both surely put death wrought confusion blood upon
if man also lie mankind lieth woman both committed abomination surely put death blood upon
if man take wife her mother wickedness burnt fire both there no among you
if man lie beast surely put death ye slay
if woman approach any beast lie down thereto thou shalt kill surely put death blood upon
if man take sister father's daughter or mother's see her nakedness she wicked thing cut off sight people hath uncovered sister's bear iniquity
if man lie woman having her sickness uncover nakedness hath discovered fountain she uncovered blood both cut off among people
thou shalt uncover nakedness thy mother's sister nor father's uncovereth near kin bear iniquity
if man lie uncle's wife hath uncovered nakedness bear sin die childless
if man take brother's wife unclean thing hath uncovered nakedness childless
ye therefore keep statutes judgments do land whither bring you dwell therein spue out
ye walk manners nation cast out before you committed these things therefore abhorred
said you ye inherit land give possess floweth milk honey am lord your god separated other people
ye therefore put difference between clean beasts unclean fowls make your souls abominable by beast or fowl any manner living thing creepeth on ground separated you
ye holy lord am severed you other people should mine
man also or woman hath familiar spirit wizard surely put death stone stones blood upon

kin near mother father son daughter brother
