these had taken strange wives some by whom children
words nehemiah son hachaliah came pass month chisleu twentieth year shushan palace
hanani one brethren came certain men judah asked concerning jews had escaped left captivity jerusalem
said remnant left captivity there province great affliction reproach wall jerusalem also broken down gates thereof burned fire
came pass heard these words sat down wept mourned certain days fasted prayed before god heaven
said beseech thee o lord god heaven great terrible keepeth covenant mercy love observe commandments
let thine ear now attentive eyes open thou mayest hear prayer thy servant pray before thee day night children israel servants confess sins we sinned against both father's house
we dealt very corruptly against thee kept commandments nor statutes judgments thou commandedst thy servant moses
remember beseech thee word thou commandedst thy servant moses saying if ye transgress scatter you abroad among nations
if ye turn keep commandments do though there you cast out uttermost part heaven yet gather thence bring place chosen set name
now these thy servants people whom thou hast redeemed by great power strong hand
o lord beseech thee let now thine ear attentive prayer thy servant servants who desire fear name prosper pray day grant mercy sight man king's cupbearer
came pass month nisan twentieth year artaxerxes king wine before took gave now had been beforetime sad presence
wherefore king said why thy countenance sad seeing thou art sick nothing else sorrow heart then very sore afraid
said king let live ever why should countenance sad city place fathers' sepulchres lieth waste gates thereof consumed fire
then king said what dost thou make request so prayed god heaven
said king if please thy servant found favour sight thou wouldest send judah city fathers' sepulchres may build
king said queen also sitting by how long thy journey wilt thou return so pleased send set time
moreover said king if please let letters given governors beyond river may convey over till come judah
letter asaph keeper king's forest may give timber make beams gates palace appertained house wall city enter king granted according good hand god upon
then came governors beyond river gave king's letters now king had sent captains army horsemen
sanballat horonite tobiah servant ammonite heard grieved exceedingly there come man seek welfare children israel
so came jerusalem there three days
arose night some few men neither told any man what god had put heart do at jerusalem there beast save rode upon
went out by night gate valley even before dragon well dung port viewed walls jerusalem broken down gates thereof consumed fire
then went on gate fountain king's pool there no place beast under pass
then went night by brook viewed wall turned back entered gate valley so returned
rulers knew whither went or what did neither had yet told jews nor priests nobles rest work
then said ye see distress we how jerusalem lieth waste gates thereof burned fire come let us build wall no more reproach
then told hand god good upon also king's words had spoken said let us rise build so strengthened hands work
sanballat horonite tobiah servant ammonite geshem arabian heard laughed us scorn despised said what thing ye do rebel against king
then answered said god heaven prosper us therefore we servants arise build ye no portion nor right memorial jerusalem
then eliashib high priest rose brethren priests builded sheep gate sanctified set doors even tower meah hananeel
next builded men jericho zaccur son imri
fish gate did sons hassenaah build who also laid beams thereof set doors locks bars
next repaired meremoth son urijah koz meshullam berechiah meshezabeel zadok baana
next tekoites repaired nobles put necks work lord
moreover old gate repaired jehoiada son paseah meshullam besodeiah laid beams thereof set doors locks bars
next repaired melatiah gibeonite jadon meronothite men gibeon mizpah throne governor on side river
next repaired uzziel son harhaiah goldsmiths also hananiah one apothecaries fortified jerusalem broad wall
next repaired rephaiah son hur ruler half part jerusalem
next repaired jedaiah son harumaph even over against house hattush hashabniah
malchijah son harim hashub pahathmoab repaired other piece tower furnaces
next repaired shallum son halohesh ruler half part jerusalem daughters
valley gate repaired hanun inhabitants zanoah built set doors thereof locks bars thousand cubits on wall dung
dung gate repaired malchiah son rechab ruler part bethhaccerem built set doors thereof locks bars
gate fountain repaired shallun son colhozeh ruler part mizpah built covered set doors thereof locks bars wall pool siloah by king's garden stairs go down city david
after repaired nehemiah son azbuk ruler half part bethzur place over against sepulchres david pool made house mighty
after repaired levites rehum son bani next hashabiah ruler half part keilah
after repaired brethren bavai son henadad ruler half part keilah
next repaired ezer son jeshua ruler mizpah another piece over against going armoury at turning wall
after baruch son zabbai earnestly repaired other piece turning wall door house eliashib high priest
after repaired meremoth son urijah koz another piece door house eliashib even end
after repaired priests men plain
after repaired benjamin hashub over against house azariah son maaseiah ananiah by
after repaired binnui son henadad another piece house azariah turning wall even corner
palal son uzai over against turning wall tower lieth out king's high house by court prison after pedaiah parosh
moreover nethinims dwelt ophel place over against water gate toward east tower lieth out
after tekoites repaired another piece over against great tower lieth out even wall ophel
above horse gate repaired priests every one over against house
after repaired zadok son immer over against house also shemaiah shechaniah keeper east gate
after repaired hananiah son shelemiah hanun sixth zalaph another piece meshullam berechiah over against chamber
after repaired malchiah goldsmith's son place nethinims merchants over against gate miphkad going corner
between going corner sheep gate repaired goldsmiths merchants
came pass sanballat heard we builded wall wroth took great indignation mocked jews
spake before brethren army samaria said what do these feeble jews fortify themselves sacrifice make end day revive stones out heaps rubbish burned
now tobiah ammonite by said even build if fox go break down stone wall
hear o our god we despised turn reproach upon own head give prey land captivity
cover iniquity let sin blotted out before thee provoked anger builders
so built we wall joined together half thereof people had mind work
came pass sanballat tobiah arabians ammonites ashdodites heard walls jerusalem made breaches began stopped then very wroth
conspired together come fight against jerusalem hinder
nevertheless we made our prayer god set watch against day night because
judah said strength bearers burdens decayed there much rubbish so we able build wall
our adversaries said know neither see till we come midst among slay cause work cease
came pass jews dwelt by said us ten times places whence ye return upon you
therefore set lower places behind wall on higher even people after families swords spears bows
looked rose said nobles rulers rest people ye afraid remember lord great terrible fight your brethren sons daughters wives houses
came pass our enemies heard known us god had brought counsel nought we returned wall every one work
came pass time forth half servants wrought work other held both spears shields bows habergeons rulers behind house judah
builded on wall bare burdens those laded every one hands wrought work other hand held weapon
builders every one had sword girded by side so builded sounded trumpet
said nobles rulers rest people work great large we separated upon wall one far another
what place therefore ye hear sound trumpet resort thither us our god fight
so we laboured work half held spears rising morning till stars appeared
likewise at same time said people let every one servant lodge within jerusalem night may guard us labour on day
so neither nor brethren servants men guard followed none us put off our clothes saving every one washing
there great cry people wives against brethren jews
there said we our sons daughters many therefore take corn may eat live
some also there said we mortgaged our lands vineyards houses might buy corn because dearth
there also said we borrowed money king's tribute upon our lands vineyards
yet now our flesh brethren children lo we bring bondage sons daughters servants some brought already neither power redeem other men lands vineyards
very angry heard cry these words
then consulted myself rebuked nobles rulers said ye exact usury every one brother set great assembly against
said we after our ability redeemed brethren jews sold heathen ye even sell your or us then held peace found nothing answer
also said good ye do ought walk fear our god because reproach heathen enemies
likewise brethren servants might exact money corn pray you let us leave off usury
restore pray you even day lands vineyards oliveyards houses also hundredth part money corn wine oil ye exact
then said we restore require nothing so do thou sayest called priests took oath should according promise
also shook lap said so god shake out every man house labour performeth promise even thus shaken emptied congregation amen praised lord people did according
moreover time appointed governor land judah twentieth year even two thirtieth artaxerxes king twelve years brethren eaten bread
former governors had been before chargeable people taken bread wine beside forty shekels silver yea even servants bare rule over so did because fear god
yea also continued work wall neither bought we any land servants gathered thither
moreover there at table hundred fifty jews rulers beside those came us among heathen about
now prepared daily one ox six choice sheep also fowls once ten days store sorts wine yet required bread governor because bondage heavy upon people
think upon god good according done people
now came pass sanballat tobiah geshem arabian rest our enemies heard had builded wall there no breach left therein though at time set doors upon gates
sanballat geshem sent saying come let us meet together some one villages plain ono thought do mischief
sent messengers saying am doing great work so cannot come down why should cease whilst leave you
yet sent four times after sort answered same manner
then sent sanballat servant like manner fifth time open letter hand
wherein written reported among heathen gashmu saith thou jews think rebel cause buildest wall mayest king according these words
thou hast also appointed prophets preach thee at jerusalem saying there king judah now reported according these words come therefore let us take counsel together
then sent saying there no such things done thou sayest feignest out thine own heart
made us afraid saying hands weakened work done now therefore o god strengthen
afterward came house shemaiah son delaiah mehetabeel who shut said let us meet together god within temple doors come slay thee yea night
said should such man flee who there being am would go temple save life
lo perceived god had sent pronounced prophecy against tobiah sanballat hired
therefore hired should afraid do so sin might matter evil report reproach
god think thou upon tobiah sanballat according these works on prophetess noadiah rest prophets would put fear
so wall finished twenty fifth day month elul fifty two days
came pass our enemies heard thereof heathen about us saw these things much cast down own eyes perceived work wrought god
moreover those days nobles judah sent many letters tobiah came
there many judah sworn because son law shechaniah arah johanan had taken daughter meshullam berechiah
also reported good deeds before uttered words tobiah sent letters put fear
now came pass wall built had set doors porters singers levites appointed
gave brother hanani hananiah ruler palace charge over jerusalem faithful man feared god above many
said let gates jerusalem opened until sun hot while stand by shut doors bar appoint watches inhabitants every one watch over against house
now city large great people few therein houses builded
god put mine heart gather together nobles rulers people might reckoned by genealogy found register came at first written therein
these children province went out captivity those had been carried away whom nebuchadnezzar king babylon came again jerusalem judah every one city
who came zerubbabel jeshua nehemiah azariah raamiah nahamani mordecai bilshan mispereth bigvai nehum baanah number say men people israel

priests children habaiah koz barzillai took one daughters gileadite wife called after name
these sought register among those reckoned by genealogy found therefore polluted put priesthood
tirshatha said should eat most holy things till there stood priest urim thummim
whole congregation together forty two thousand three hundred threescore
beside manservants maidservants whom there seven thousand three hundred thirty had two forty five singing men women
horses seven hundred thirty six mules two forty five
camels four hundred thirty five six thousand seven twenty asses
some chief fathers gave work tirshatha treasure thousand drams gold fifty basons five hundred thirty priests' garments
some chief fathers gave treasure work twenty thousand drams gold two hundred pound silver
rest people gave twenty thousand drams gold two pound silver threescore seven priests' garments
so priests levites porters singers some people nethinims israel dwelt cities seventh month came children
people gathered themselves together one man street before water gate spake ezra scribe bring book law moses lord had commanded israel
ezra priest brought law before congregation both men women could hear understanding upon first day seventh month
read therein before street water gate morning until midday men women those could understand ears people attentive book law
ezra scribe stood upon pulpit wood had made purpose beside mattithiah shema anaiah urijah hilkiah maaseiah on right hand left pedaiah mishael malchiah hashum hashbadana zechariah meshullam
ezra opened book sight people above stood
ezra blessed lord great god people answered amen lifting hands bowed heads worshipped faces ground
also jeshua bani sherebiah jamin akkub shabbethai hodijah maaseiah kelita azariah jozabad hanan pelaiah levites caused people understand law stood place
so read book law god distinctly gave sense caused understand reading
nehemiah tirshatha ezra priest scribe levites taught people said day holy lord your god mourn nor weep wept heard words law
then said go your way eat fat drink sweet send portions whom nothing prepared day holy our lord neither ye sorry joy strength
so levites stilled people saying hold your peace day holy neither ye grieved
people went way eat drink send portions make great mirth because had understood words declared
on second day gathered together chief fathers people priests levites ezra scribe even understand words law
found written law lord had commanded by moses children israel should dwell booths feast seventh month
should publish proclaim cities jerusalem saying go forth mount fetch olive branches pine myrtle palm thick trees make booths written
so people went forth brought made themselves booths every one upon roof house courts god street water gate ephraim
congregation come again out captivity made booths sat under since days jeshua son nun day had children israel done so there very great gladness
also day by first last read book law god kept feast seven days on eighth solemn assembly according manner
now twenty fourth day month children israel assembled fasting sackclothes earth upon
seed israel separated themselves strangers stood confessed sins iniquities fathers
stood place read book law lord god one fourth part day another confessed worshipped
then stood upon stairs levites jeshua bani kadmiel shebaniah bunni sherebiah chenani cried loud voice lord god
then levites jeshua kadmiel bani hashabniah sherebiah hodijah shebaniah pethahiah said stand bless lord your god ever blessed thy glorious name exalted above blessing praise
thou even art lord alone hast made heaven heavens host earth things therein seas preservest worshippeth thee
thou art lord god who didst choose abram broughtest forth out ur chaldees gavest name abraham
foundest heart faithful before thee madest covenant give land canaanites hittites amorites perizzites jebusites girgashites say seed hast performed thy words thou art righteous
didst see affliction our fathers egypt heardest cry by red sea
shewedst signs wonders upon pharaoh on servants people land thou knewest dealt proudly against so didst get thee name day
thou didst divide sea before so went through midst on dry land persecutors threwest deeps stone mighty waters
moreover thou leddest day by cloudy pillar night fire give light way wherein should go
thou camest down also upon mount sinai spakest heaven gavest right judgments true laws good statutes commandments
madest known thy holy sabbath commandedst precepts statutes laws by hand moses servant
gavest bread heaven hunger broughtest forth water out rock thirst promisedst should go possess land thou hadst sworn give
our fathers dealt proudly hardened necks hearkened thy commandments
refused obey neither mindful thy wonders thou didst among hardened necks rebellion appointed captain return bondage art god ready pardon gracious merciful slow anger great kindness forsookest
yea had made molten calf said thy god brought thee out egypt wrought great provocations
yet thou thy manifold mercies forsookest wilderness pillar cloud departed by day lead way neither fire night shew light wherein should go
thou gavest also thy good spirit instruct withheldest manna mouth water thirst
yea forty years didst thou sustain wilderness so lacked nothing clothes waxed old feet swelled
moreover thou gavest kingdoms nations didst divide corners so possessed land sihon king heshbon og bashan
children also multipliedst thou stars heaven broughtest land concerning hadst promised fathers should go possess
so children went possessed land thou subduedst before inhabitants canaanites gavest hands kings people might do would
took strong cities fat land possessed houses full goods wells digged vineyards oliveyards fruit trees abundance so did eat filled became delighted themselves thy great goodness
nevertheless disobedient rebelled against thee cast thy law behind backs slew prophets testified turn wrought great provocations
therefore thou deliveredst hand enemies who vexed time trouble cried thee heardest heaven according thy manifold mercies gavest saviours saved out
after had rest did evil again before thee therefore leftest thou hand enemies so dominion over yet returned cried heardest heaven many times didst deliver according thy mercies
testifiedst against thou mightest bring again thy law yet dealt proudly hearkened commandments sinned judgments if man do live withdrew shoulder hardened neck would hear
yet many years didst thou forbear testifiedst against by thy spirit prophets would give ear therefore gavest hand people lands
nevertheless thy great mercies' sake thou didst utterly consume nor forsake art gracious merciful god
now therefore our god great mighty terrible who keepest covenant mercy let trouble seem little before thee hath come upon us on kings princes priests prophets fathers thy people since time assyria day
howbeit thou art just brought upon us hast done right we wickedly
neither our kings princes priests nor fathers kept thy law hearkened commandments testimonies wherewith thou didst testify against
served thee kingdom thy great goodness thou gavest large fat land before neither turned wicked works
behold we servants day land thou gavest our fathers eat fruit thereof good
yieldeth much increase kings whom thou hast set over us because our sins also dominion bodies cattle at pleasure we great distress
because we make sure covenant write our princes levites priests seal
now those sealed nehemiah tirshatha son hachaliah zidkijah

rest people priests levites porters singers nethinims had separated themselves lands law god wives sons daughters every one having knowledge understanding
clave brethren nobles entered curse oath walk god's law given by moses servant god observe do commandments lord our judgments statutes
we would give our daughters people land nor take sons
if people land bring ware or any victuals on sabbath day sell we would buy holy leave seventh year exaction every debt
also we made ordinances us charge ourselves yearly third part shekel service house our god
shewbread continual meat offering burnt sabbaths new moons set feasts holy things sin offerings make atonement israel work house our god
we cast lots among priests levites people wood offering bring house our god after houses fathers at times appointed year by burn upon altar lord written law
bring firstfruits our ground fruit trees year by house lord
also firstborn our sons cattle written law firstlings herds flocks bring house god priests minister
we should bring firstfruits our dough offerings fruit manner trees wine oil priests chambers house god tithes ground levites same might cities tillage
priest son aaron levites take tithes bring tithe house our god chambers treasure
children israel levi bring offering corn new wine oil chambers where vessels sanctuary priests minister porters singers we forsake house our god
rulers people dwelt at jerusalem rest also cast lots bring one ten dwell holy city nine parts other cities
people blessed men willingly offered themselves dwell at jerusalem
now these chief province dwelt jerusalem cities judah every one possession wit israel priests levites nethinims children solomon's servants

at dedication wall jerusalem sought levites out places bring keep gladness both thanksgivings singing cymbals psalteries harps
sons singers gathered themselves together both out plain country round about jerusalem villages netophathi

days david asaph old there chief singers songs praise thanksgiving god
israel days zerubbabel nehemiah gave portions singers porters every day portion sanctified holy things levites children aaron
on day read book moses audience people therein found written ammonite moabite should come congregation god ever
because met children israel bread water hired balaam against should curse howbeit our god turned blessing
now came pass had heard law separated israel mixed multitude
before eliashib priest having oversight chamber house our god allied tobiah
had prepared great chamber where aforetime laid meat offerings frankincense vessels tithes corn new wine oil commanded given levites singers porters priests
time at jerusalem two thirtieth year artaxerxes king babylon came after certain days obtained leave
came jerusalem understood evil eliashib did tobiah preparing chamber courts house god
grieved sore therefore cast forth household stuff tobiah out chamber
then commanded cleansed chambers thither brought again vessels house god meat offering frankincense
perceived portions levites had been given singers did work fled every one field
then contended rulers said why house god forsaken gathered together set place
then brought judah tithe corn new wine oil treasuries
made treasurers over treasuries shelemiah priest zadok scribe levites pedaiah next hanan son zaccur mattaniah counted faithful office distribute brethren
remember o god concerning wipe out good deeds done house offices thereof
those days saw judah some treading wine presses on sabbath bringing sheaves lading asses also grapes figs manner burdens brought jerusalem day testified against wherein sold victuals
there dwelt men tyre also therein brought fish manner ware sold on sabbath children judah jerusalem
then contended nobles judah said what evil thing ye do profane sabbath day
did your fathers thus our god bring evil upon us city yet ye more wrath israel by profaning sabbath
came pass gates jerusalem began dark before sabbath commanded should shut charged opened till after some servants set at there no burden brought on day
so merchants sellers kind ware lodged without jerusalem once or twice
then testified against said why lodge ye about wall if do so again lay hands on you time forth came no more sabbath
commanded levites should cleanse themselves come keep gates sanctify sabbath day remember o god concerning also spare according greatness thy mercy
those days also saw jews had married wives ashdod ammon moab
children spake half speech ashdod could speak jews' language according each people
contended cursed smote certain plucked off hair made swear by god saying ye give your daughters sons nor take or yourselves
did solomon king israel sin by these things yet among many nations there no like who beloved god made over nevertheless even outlandish women cause
we then hearken you do great evil transgress against our god marrying strange wives
one sons joiada son eliashib high priest law sanballat horonite therefore chased
remember o god because defiled priesthood covenant levites
thus cleansed strangers appointed wards priests levites every one business
wood offering at times appointed firstfruits remember o god good
now came pass days ahasuerus reigned india even ethiopia over hundred seven twenty provinces
those days king ahasuerus sat on throne kingdom shushan palace
third year reign made feast princes servants power persia media nobles provinces being before
shewed riches glorious kingdom honour excellent majesty many days even hundred fourscore
these days expired king made feast people present shushan palace both great small seven court garden king's
where white green blue hangings fastened cords fine linen purple silver rings pillars marble beds gold upon pavement red black
gave drink vessels gold being diverse one another royal wine abundance according state king
drinking according law none did compel so king had appointed officers house should do every man's pleasure
also vashti queen made feast women royal house belonged king ahasuerus
on seventh day heart king merry wine commanded mehuman biztha harbona bigtha abagtha zethar carcas seven chamberlains served presence ahasuerus
bring vashti queen before king crown royal shew people princes her beauty she fair look on
queen vashti refused come at king's commandment by chamberlains therefore king very wroth anger burned
then king said wise men knew times so king's manner toward law judgment
next carshena shethar admatha tarshish meres marsena memucan seven princes persia media saw king's face sat first kingdom
what we do queen vashti according law because she hath performed commandment king ahasuerus by chamberlains
memucan answered before king princes vashti queen hath done wrong only also people provinces ahasuerus
deed queen come abroad women so despise husbands eyes reported king ahasuerus commanded vashti brought before she came
likewise ladies persia media say day king's princes heard deed queen thus there arise too much contempt wrath
if please king let there go royal commandment written among laws persians medes altered vashti come no more before ahasuerus give her estate another better than she
king's decree make published throughout empire great wives give husbands honour both small
saying pleased king princes did according word memucan
sent letters king's provinces every province according writing thereof people after language man should bear rule own house published
after these things wrath king ahasuerus appeased remembered vashti what she had done decreed against her
then said king's servants ministered let there fair young virgins sought king
let king appoint officers provinces kingdom may gather together fair young virgins shushan palace house women custody hege king's chamberlain keeper things purification given
let maiden pleaseth king queen instead vashti thing pleased did so
now shushan palace there certain jew whose name mordecai son jair shimei kish benjamite
who had been carried away jerusalem captivity jeconiah king judah whom nebuchadnezzar babylon
brought hadassah esther uncle's daughter she had neither father nor mother maid fair beautiful whom mordecai her dead took own
so came pass king's commandment decree heard many maidens gathered together shushan palace custody hegai esther brought also house keeper women
maiden pleased she obtained kindness speedily gave her things purification such belonged seven maidens meet given out king's house preferred maids best place women
esther had shewed her people nor kindred mordecai charged she should shew
mordecai walked every day before court women's house know how esther did what should become her
now every maid's turn come go king ahasuerus after she had been twelve months according manner women so days purifications accomplished wit six oil myrrh sweet odours other things purifying
then thus came every maiden king whatsoever she desired given her go out house women king's
evening she went on morrow returned second house women custody shaashgaz king's chamberlain kept concubines came king no more except delighted her called by name
now turn esther daughter abihail uncle mordecai who had taken her come go king she required nothing what hegai king's chamberlain keeper women appointed obtained favour sight looked upon
so esther taken king ahasuerus house royal tenth month tebeth seventh year reign
king loved esther above women she obtained grace favour sight more than virgins so set royal crown upon her head made queen instead vashti
then king made great feast princes servants even esther's release provinces gave gifts according state
virgins gathered together second time then mordecai sat king's gate
esther had yet shewed her kindred nor people mordecai charged did commandment like she brought
those days while mordecai sat king's gate two chamberlains bigthan teresh kept door wroth sought lay hand on king ahasuerus
thing known mordecai who told esther queen certified king thereof mordecai's name
inquisition made matter found out therefore both hanged on tree written book chronicles before king
after these things did king ahasuerus promote haman son hammedatha agagite advanced set seat above princes
king's servants gate bowed reverenced haman king had so commanded concerning mordecai nor did reverence
then king's servants gate said mordecai why transgressest thou commandment
now came pass spake daily hearkened told haman see whether mordecai's matters would stand had jew
haman saw mordecai bowed nor did reverence then full wrath
thought scorn lay hands on mordecai alone had shewed people wherefore haman sought destroy jews throughout whole kingdom ahasuerus even
first month nisan twelfth year king ahasuerus cast pur lot before haman day adar
haman said king ahasuerus there certain people scattered abroad dispersed among provinces thy kingdom laws diverse neither keep king's therefore profit suffer
if please king let written may destroyed pay ten thousand talents silver hands those charge business bring king's treasuries
king took ring hand gave haman son hammedatha agagite jews' enemy
king said haman silver given thee people also do seemeth good
then king's scribes called on thirteenth day first month there written according haman had commanded lieutenants governors over every province rulers people writing thereof after language name king ahasuerus sealed ring
letters sent by posts king's provinces destroy kill cause perish jews both young old little children women one day even upon thirteenth twelfth month adar take spoil prey
copy writing commandment given every province published people should ready against day
posts went out being hastened by king's commandment decree given shushan palace king haman sat down drink city perplexed
mordecai perceived done rent clothes put on sackcloth ashes went out midst city cried loud bitter cry
came even before king's gate none might enter clothed sackcloth
every province whithersoever king's commandment decree came there great mourning among jews fasting weeping wailing many lay sackcloth ashes
so esther's maids her chamberlains came told then queen exceedingly grieved she sent raiment clothe mordecai take away sackcloth received
then called esther hatach one king's chamberlains whom had appointed attend upon her gave commandment mordecai know what why
so hatach went forth mordecai street city before king's gate
mordecai told had happened sum money haman promised pay king's treasuries jews destroy
also gave copy writing decree given at shushan destroy shew esther declare her charge she should go king make supplication request before people
hatach came told esther words mordecai
again esther spake hatach gave commandment mordecai
king's servants people provinces do know whosoever whether man or woman come king inner court who called there one law put death except such whom hold out golden sceptre may live been these thirty days
told mordecai esther's words
then mordecai commanded answer esther think thyself thou shalt escape king's house more than jews
if thou altogether holdest thy peace at time then there enlargement deliverance arise jews another place father's house destroyed who knoweth whether art come kingdom such
then esther bade return mordecai answer
go gather together jews present shushan fast ye neither eat nor drink three days night or day also maidens likewise so king according law if perish
so mordecai went way did according esther had commanded
now came pass on third day esther put her royal apparel stood inner court king's house over against king sat upon throne gate
so king saw esther queen standing court she obtained favour sight held out golden sceptre hand drew near touched top
then said king her what wilt thou queen esther thy request even given thee half kingdom
esther answered if seem good king let haman come day banquet prepared
then king said cause haman make haste may do esther hath so came banquet had prepared
king said esther at banquet wine what thy petition granted thee request even half kingdom performed
then answered esther said petition request
if found favour sight king please grant petition perform request let haman come banquet prepare do morrow hath said
then went haman forth day joyful glad heart saw mordecai king's gate stood nor moved full indignation against
nevertheless haman refrained himself came home sent called friends zeresh wife
haman told glory riches multitude children things wherein king had promoted how advanced above princes servants
haman said moreover yea esther queen did let no man come king banquet she had prepared myself morrow am invited her also
yet availeth nothing so long see mordecai jew sitting at king's gate
then said zeresh wife friends let gallows made fifty cubits high morrow speak thou king mordecai may hanged thereon go merrily banquet thing pleased haman caused
on night could king sleep commanded bring book records chronicles read before
found written mordecai had told bigthana teresh two king's chamberlains keepers door who sought lay hand on king ahasuerus
king said what honour dignity hath been done mordecai then king's servants ministered there nothing
king said who court now haman come outward king's house speak hang mordecai on gallows had prepared
king's servants said behold haman standeth court king let come
so haman came king said what done man whom delighteth honour now thought heart would delight do more than myself
haman answered king man whom delighteth honour
let royal apparel brought king useth wear horse rideth upon crown set head
let apparel horse delivered hand one king's most noble princes may array man withal whom king delighteth honour bring on horseback through street city proclaim before thus done
then king said haman make haste take apparel horse thou hast do even so mordecai jew sitteth at king's gate let nothing fail spoken
then took haman apparel horse arrayed mordecai brought on horseback through street city proclaimed before thus done man whom king delighteth honour
mordecai came again king's gate haman hasted house mourning having head covered
haman told zeresh wife friends every thing had befallen then said wise men if mordecai seed jews before whom thou hast begun fall shalt prevail against surely
while yet talking came king's chamberlains hasted bring haman banquet esther had prepared
so king haman came banquet esther queen
king said again esther on second day at banquet wine what thy petition queen granted thee request performed even half kingdom
then esther queen answered said if found favour thy sight o king please let life given at petition people request
we sold people destroyed slain perish if had been bondmen bondwomen held tongue although enemy could countervail king's damage
then king ahasuerus answered said esther queen who where durst presume heart do so
esther said adversary enemy wicked haman then afraid before king queen
king arising banquet wine wrath went palace garden haman stood make request life esther queen saw there evil determined against by
then king returned out palace garden place banquet wine haman fallen upon bed whereon esther said force queen also before house word went king's mouth covered haman's face
harbonah one chamberlains said before king behold also gallows fifty cubits high haman had made mordecai who spoken good standeth house then hang thereon
so hanged haman on gallows had prepared mordecai then king's wrath pacified
on day did king ahasuerus give house haman jews' enemy esther queen mordecai came before had told what her
king took off ring had taken haman gave mordecai esther set over house
esther spake yet again before king fell down at feet besought tears put away mischief haman agagite device had devised against jews
then king held out golden sceptre toward esther so arose stood before
said if please king found favour sight thing seem right before pleasing eyes let written reverse letters devised by haman son hammedatha agagite wrote destroy jews king's provinces
how can endure see evil come people or destruction kindred
then king ahasuerus said esther queen mordecai jew behold given house haman hanged upon gallows because laid hand jews
write ye also jews liketh you king's name seal ring writing written sealed may no man reverse
then king's scribes called at time third month sivan on three twentieth day thereof written according mordecai commanded jews lieutenants deputies rulers provinces india ethiopia hundred twenty seven every province writing people after language
wrote king ahasuerus' name sealed king's ring sent letters by posts on horseback riders mules camels young dromedaries
wherein king granted jews every city gather themselves together stand life destroy slay cause perish power people province would assault both little ones women take spoil prey
upon one day provinces king ahasuerus namely thirteenth twelfth month adar
copy writing commandment given every province published people jews should ready against day avenge themselves on enemies
so posts rode upon mules camels went out being hastened pressed on by king's commandment decree given at shushan palace
mordecai went out presence king royal apparel blue white great crown gold garment fine linen purple city shushan rejoiced glad
jews had light gladness joy honour
every province city whithersoever king's commandment decree came jews had joy gladness feast good day many people land became fear fell upon
now twelfth month adar on thirteenth day same king's commandment decree drew near put execution enemies jews hoped power over though turned contrary had rule hated
jews gathered themselves together cities throughout provinces king ahasuerus lay hand on such sought hurt no man could withstand fear fell upon people
rulers provinces lieutenants deputies officers king helped jews because fear mordecai fell upon
mordecai great king's house fame went out throughout provinces man waxed greater
thus jews smote enemies stroke sword slaughter destruction did what would those hated
shushan palace jews slew destroyed five hundred men
parshandatha dalphon aspatha
poratha adalia aridatha
parmashta arisai aridai vajezatha
ten sons haman son hammedatha enemy jews slew on spoil laid hand
on day number those slain shushan palace brought before king
king said esther queen jews slain destroyed five hundred men shushan palace ten sons haman what done rest king's provinces now thy petition granted thee or request further
then said esther if please king let granted jews shushan do morrow also according day's decree haman's ten sons hanged upon gallows
king commanded so done decree given at shushan hanged haman's ten sons
jews shushan gathered themselves together on fourteenth day also month adar slew three hundred men at prey laid hand
other jews king's provinces gathered themselves together stood lives had rest enemies slew foes seventy five thousand laid hands on prey
on thirteenth day month adar fourteenth same rested made feasting gladness
jews at shushan assembled together on thirteenth day thereof fourteenth fifteenth same rested made feasting gladness
therefore jews villages dwelt unwalled towns made fourteenth day month adar gladness feasting good sending portions one another
mordecai wrote these things sent letters jews provinces king ahasuerus both nigh far
stablish among should keep fourteenth day month adar fifteenth same yearly
days wherein jews rested enemies month turned sorrow joy mourning good day should make feasting sending portions one another gifts poor
jews undertook do had begun mordecai written
because haman son hammedatha agagite enemy jews had devised against destroy cast pur lot consume
esther came before king commanded by letters wicked device devised against jews should return upon own head sons hanged on gallows
wherefore called these days purim after name pur therefore words letter had seen concerning matter come
jews ordained took upon seed such joined themselves so should fail would keep these two days according writing appointed time every year
these days should remembered kept throughout every generation family province city purim fail among jews nor memorial perish seed
then esther queen daughter abihail mordecai jew wrote authority confirm second letter purim
sent letters jews hundred twenty seven provinces kingdom ahasuerus words peace truth
confirm these days purim times appointed according mordecai jew esther queen had enjoined decreed themselves seed matters fastings cry
decree esther confirmed these matters purim written book
king ahasuerus laid tribute upon land isles sea
acts power might declaration greatness mordecai whereunto king advanced written book chronicles kings media persia
mordecai jew next king ahasuerus great among jews accepted multitude brethren seeking wealth people speaking peace seed
there man land uz whose name job perfect upright one feared god eschewed evil
there born seven sons three daughters
substance also seven thousand sheep three camels five hundred yoke oxen she asses very great household so man greatest men east
sons went feasted houses every one day sent called three sisters eat drink
so days feasting gone about job sent sanctified rose early morning offered burnt offerings according number said may sons sinned cursed god hearts thus did continually
now there day sons god came present themselves before lord satan also among
lord said satan whence comest thou then answered going fro earth walking down
lord said satan hast thou considered servant job there none like earth perfect upright man one feareth god escheweth evil
then satan answered lord said doth job fear god nought
hast thou made hedge about house hath on every side blessed work hands substance increased land
put forth thine hand now touch hath curse thee thy face
lord said satan behold hath thy power only upon himself put forth thine hand so went presence
there day sons daughters eating drinking wine eldest brother's house
there came messenger job said oxen plowing asses feeding beside
sabeans fell upon took away yea slain servants edge sword only am escaped alone tell thee
while yet speaking there came also another said fire god fallen heaven hath burned sheep servants consumed only am escaped alone tell thee
while yet speaking there came also another said chaldeans made out three bands fell upon camels carried away yea slain servants edge sword only am escaped alone tell thee
while yet speaking there came also another said thy sons daughters eating drinking wine eldest brother's house
behold there came great wind wilderness smote four corners house fell upon young men dead only am escaped alone tell thee
then job arose rent mantle shaved head fell down upon ground worshipped
said naked came out mother's womb return thither lord gave hath taken away blessed name
job sinned nor charged god foolishly
again there day sons god came present themselves before lord satan also among himself
lord said satan whence comest thou answered going fro earth walking down
lord said satan hast thou considered servant job there none like earth perfect upright man one feareth god escheweth evil still holdeth fast integrity although movedst against destroy without cause
satan answered lord said skin yea man hath give life
put forth thine hand now touch bone flesh curse thee thy face
lord said satan behold thine hand save life
so went satan forth presence lord smote job sore boils sole foot crown
took potsherd scrape himself withal sat down among ashes
then said wife dost thou still retain thine integrity curse god die
said her thou speakest one foolish women speaketh what we receive good at hand god evil did job sin lips
now job's three friends heard evil come upon came every one own place eliphaz temanite bildad shuhite zophar naamathite had made appointment together mourn comfort
lifted eyes afar off knew voice wept rent every one mantle sprinkled dust upon heads toward heaven
so sat down upon ground seven days nights none spake word saw grief very great
after opened job mouth cursed day
job spake said
let day perish wherein born night said there man child conceived
let day darkness god regard above neither light shine upon
let darkness shadow death stain cloud dwell upon blackness day terrify
night let darkness seize upon joined days year come number months
lo let night solitary no joyful voice come therein
let curse day who ready raise mourning
let stars twilight thereof dark look light none neither see dawning day
because shut doors mother's womb nor hid sorrow mine eyes
why died womb did give ghost came out belly
why did knees prevent or breasts should suck
now should lain still been quiet slept then had at rest
kings counsellors earth built desolate places themselves
or princes had gold who filled houses silver
or hidden untimely birth had been infants never saw light
there wicked cease troubling weary at rest
there prisoners rest together hear voice oppressor
small great there servant free master
wherefore light given misery life bitter soul
long death cometh dig more than hid treasures
rejoice exceedingly glad can find grave
why light given man whose way hid whom god hath hedged
sighing cometh before eat roarings poured out like waters
thing greatly feared come upon afraid
safety neither had rest quiet yet trouble came
then eliphaz temanite answered said
if we assay commune thee wilt thou grieved who can withhold himself speaking
behold thou hast instructed many strengthened weak hands
thy words upholden falling thou hast strengthened feeble knees
now come upon thee thou faintest toucheth art troubled
thy fear confidence hope uprightness ways
remember pray thee who ever perished being innocent or where righteous cut off
even seen plow iniquity sow wickedness reap same
by blast god perish breath nostrils consumed
roaring lion voice fierce teeth young lions broken
old lion perisheth lack prey stout lion's whelps scattered abroad
now thing secretly brought mine ear received little thereof
thoughts visions night deep sleep falleth on men
fear came upon trembling made bones shake
then spirit passed before face hair flesh stood
stood still could discern form thereof image before mine eyes there silence heard voice saying
mortal man more just than god pure maker
behold put no trust servants angels charged folly
how much less dwell houses clay whose foundation dust crushed before moth
destroyed morning evening perish ever without any regarding
doth excellency go away die even without wisdom
call now if there any answer thee saints wilt thou turn
wrath killeth foolish man envy slayeth silly one
seen foolish taking root suddenly cursed habitation
children far safety crushed gate neither there any deliver
whose harvest hungry eateth taketh even out thorns robber swalloweth substance
although affliction cometh forth dust neither doth trouble spring out ground
yet man born trouble sparks fly upward
would seek god commit cause
doeth great things unsearchable marvellous without number
who giveth rain upon earth sendeth waters fields
set on high those low mourn may exalted safety
disappointeth devices crafty so hands cannot perform enterprise
taketh wise own craftiness counsel froward carried headlong
meet darkness daytime grope noonday night
saveth poor sword mouth hand mighty
so poor hath hope iniquity stoppeth her mouth
behold happy man whom god correcteth therefore despise thou chastening almighty
maketh sore bindeth woundeth hands make whole
deliver thee six troubles yea seven there no evil touch
famine redeem thee death war power sword
thou shalt hid scourge tongue neither afraid destruction cometh
at destruction famine thou shalt laugh neither afraid beasts earth
thou shalt league stones field beasts at peace thee
thou shalt know thy tabernacle peace visit habitation sin
thou shalt know also thy seed great thine offspring grass earth
thou shalt come thy grave full age like shock corn cometh season
lo we searched so hear know thou thy good
job answered said
oh grief throughly weighed calamity laid balances together
now would heavier than sand sea therefore words swallowed
arrows almighty within poison whereof drinketh spirit terrors god do set themselves array against
doth wild ass bray hath grass or loweth ox over fodder
can unsavoury eaten without salt or there any taste white egg
things soul refused touch sorrowful meat
oh might request god would grant thing long
even would please god destroy let loose hand cut off
then should yet comfort yea would harden myself sorrow let spare concealed words holy one
what strength should hope mine end prolong life
strength stones or flesh brass
help wisdom driven quite
afflicted pity should shewed friend forsaketh fear almighty
brethren dealt deceitfully brook stream brooks pass away
blackish by reason ice wherein snow hid
what time wax warm vanish hot consumed out place
paths way turned aside go nothing perish
troops tema looked companies sheba waited
confounded because had hoped came thither ashamed
now ye nothing see casting down afraid
did say bring or give reward your substance
or deliver enemy's hand redeem mighty
teach hold tongue cause understand wherein erred
how forcible right words what doth your arguing reprove
do ye imagine reprove words speeches one desperate wind
yea ye overwhelm fatherless dig pit your friend
now therefore content look upon evident you if lie
return pray you let iniquity yea again righteousness
there iniquity tongue cannot taste discern perverse things
there appointed time man upon earth days also like hireling
servant earnestly desireth shadow hireling looketh reward work
so am made possess months vanity wearisome nights appointed
lie down say arise night gone am full tossings fro dawning day
flesh clothed worms clods dust skin broken become loathsome
days swifter than weaver's shuttle spent without hope
o remember life wind mine eye no more see good
eye hath seen see no more thine eyes upon am
cloud consumed vanisheth away so goeth down grave come no more
return no more house neither place know any
therefore refrain mouth speak anguish spirit complain bitterness soul
am sea or whale thou settest watch over
say bed comfort couch ease complaint
then thou scarest dreams terrifiest through visions
so soul chooseth strangling death rather than life
loathe would live alway let alone days vanity
what man thou shouldest magnify set thine heart upon
thou shouldest visit every morning try moment
how long wilt thou depart nor let alone till swallow down spittle
sinned what do thee o thou preserver men why hast set mark against so am burden myself
why dost thou pardon transgression take away mine iniquity now sleep dust shalt seek morning
then answered bildad shuhite said
how long wilt thou speak these things words thy mouth like strong wind
doth god pervert judgment or almighty justice
if thy children sinned against cast away transgression
if thou wouldest seek god betimes make thy supplication almighty
if thou wert pure upright surely now would awake thee make habitation thy righteousness prosperous
though thy beginning small yet latter end should greatly increase
enquire pray thee former age prepare thyself search fathers
we yesterday know nothing because our days upon earth shadow
teach thee tell utter words out heart
can rush grow without mire flag water
whilst yet greenness cut down withereth before any other herb
so paths forget god hypocrite's hope perish
whose hope cut off trust spider's web
lean upon house stand hold fast endure
green before sun branch shooteth forth garden
roots wrapped about heap seeth place stones
if destroy place then deny saying seen thee
behold joy way out earth others grow
behold god cast away perfect man neither help evil doers
till fill thy mouth laughing lips rejoicing
hate thee clothed shame dwelling place wicked come nought
then job answered said
know so truth how should man just god
if contend cannot answer one thousand
wise heart mighty strength who hath hardened himself against prospered
removeth mountains know overturneth anger
shaketh earth out her place pillars thereof tremble
commandeth sun riseth sealeth stars
alone spreadeth out heavens treadeth upon waves sea
maketh arcturus orion pleiades chambers south
doeth great things past finding out yea wonders without number
lo goeth by see passeth on also perceive
behold taketh away who can hinder say what doest thou
if god withdraw anger proud helpers do stoop under
how much less answer choose out words reason
whom though righteous yet would answer make supplication judge
if had called answered yet would believe hearkened voice
breaketh tempest multiplieth wounds without cause
suffer take breath filleth bitterness
if speak strength lo strong judgment who set time plead
if justify myself mine own mouth condemn say am perfect also prove perverse
though perfect yet would know soul despise life
one thing therefore said destroyeth perfect wicked
if scourge slay suddenly laugh at trial innocent
earth given hand wicked covereth faces judges thereof if where who
now days swifter than post flee away see no good
passed away swift ships eagle hasteth prey
if say forget complaint leave off heaviness comfort myself
am afraid sorrows know thou wilt hold innocent
if wicked why then labour vain
if wash myself snow water make hands never so clean
yet shalt thou plunge ditch mine own clothes abhor
man am should answer we come together judgment
neither there any daysman betwixt us might lay hand upon both
let take rod away fear terrify
then would speak fear so
soul weary life leave complaint upon myself speak bitterness
say god do condemn shew wherefore thou contendest
good thee thou shouldest oppress despise work thine hands shine upon counsel wicked
hast thou eyes flesh or seest man seeth
thy days man years man's
thou enquirest after mine iniquity searchest sin
thou knowest am wicked there none can deliver out thine hand
thine hands made fashioned together round about yet thou dost destroy
remember beseech thee thou hast made clay wilt bring dust again
hast thou poured out milk curdled like cheese
thou hast clothed skin flesh fenced bones sinews
thou hast granted life favour thy visitation hath preserved spirit
these things hast thou hid thine heart know thee
if sin then thou markest wilt acquit mine iniquity
if wicked woe righteous yet lift head am full confusion therefore see thou mine affliction
increaseth thou huntest fierce lion again shewest thyself marvellous upon
thou renewest thy witnesses against increasest thine indignation upon changes war
wherefore then hast thou brought forth out womb oh had given ghost no eye seen
should been though had carried womb grave
days few cease then let alone may take comfort little
before go whence return even land darkness shadow death
land darkness itself shadow death without any order where light
then answered zophar naamathite said
should multitude words answered man full talk justified
should thy lies make men hold peace thou mockest no man thee ashamed
thou hast said doctrine pure am clean thine eyes
oh god would speak open lips against thee
would shew thee secrets wisdom double know therefore god exacteth less than thine iniquity deserveth
canst thou by searching find out god almighty perfection
high heaven what canst thou do deeper than hell know
measure thereof longer than earth broader sea
if cut off shut or gather together then who can hinder
knoweth vain men seeth wickedness also then consider
vain man would wise though born like wild ass's colt
if thou prepare thine heart stretch out hands toward
if iniquity thine hand put far away let wickedness dwell thy tabernacles
then shalt thou lift thy face without spot yea stedfast fear
because thou shalt forget thy misery remember waters pass away
thine age clearer than noonday thou shalt shine forth morning
thou shalt secure because there hope yea dig about thee take thy rest safety
also thou shalt lie down none make thee afraid yea many suit
eyes wicked fail escape hope giving ghost
job answered said
no doubt ye people wisdom die you
understanding well you am inferior yea who knoweth such things these
am one mocked neighbour who calleth upon god answereth just upright man laughed scorn
ready slip feet lamp despised thought at ease
tabernacles robbers prosper provoke god secure whose hand bringeth abundantly
ask now beasts teach thee fowls air tell
or speak earth teach thee fishes sea declare
who knoweth these hand lord hath wrought
whose hand soul every living thing breath mankind
doth ear try words mouth taste meat
ancient wisdom length days understanding
wisdom strength hath counsel understanding
behold breaketh down cannot built again shutteth man there can no opening
behold withholdeth waters dry also sendeth out overturn earth
strength wisdom deceived deceiver
leadeth counsellors away spoiled maketh judges fools
looseth bond kings girdeth loins girdle
leadeth princes away spoiled overthroweth mighty
removeth away speech trusty taketh understanding aged
poureth contempt upon princes weakeneth strength mighty
discovereth deep things out darkness bringeth light shadow death
increaseth nations destroyeth enlargeth straiteneth again
taketh away heart chief people earth causeth wander wilderness where there no way
grope dark without light maketh stagger like drunken man
lo mine eye hath seen ear heard understood
what ye know same do also am inferior you
surely would speak almighty desire reason god
ye forgers lies physicians no value
o ye would altogether hold your peace should wisdom
hear now reasoning hearken pleadings lips
ye speak wickedly god talk deceitfully
ye accept person contend god
good should search you out or one man mocketh another do ye so mock
surely reprove you if ye do secretly accept persons
excellency make you afraid dread fall upon
your remembrances like ashes bodies clay
hold your peace let alone may speak come on what
wherefore do take flesh teeth put life mine hand
though slay yet trust maintain mine own ways before
also salvation hypocrite come before
hear diligently speech declaration your ears
behold now ordered cause know justified
who plead now if hold tongue give ghost
only do two things then hide myself thee
withdraw thine hand far let thy dread make afraid
then call thou answer or let speak
how many mine iniquities sins make know transgression sin
wherefore hidest thou thy face holdest thine enemy
wilt thou break leaf driven fro pursue dry stubble
thou writest bitter things against makest possess iniquities youth
thou puttest feet also stocks lookest narrowly paths settest print upon heels
rotten thing consumeth garment moth eaten
man born woman few days full trouble
cometh forth like flower cut down fleeth also shadow continueth
dost thou open thine eyes upon such one bringest judgment thee
who can bring clean thing out unclean one
seeing days determined number months thee thou hast appointed bounds cannot pass
turn may rest till accomplish hireling day
there hope tree if cut down sprout again tender branch thereof cease
though root thereof wax old earth stock die ground
yet through scent water bud bring forth boughs like plant
man dieth wasteth away yea giveth ghost where
waters fail sea flood decayeth drieth
so man lieth down riseth till heavens no more awake nor raised out sleep
o thou wouldest hide grave keep secret until thy wrath past appoint set time remember
if man die live again days appointed time wait till change come
thou shalt call answer thee wilt desire work thine hands
now thou numberest steps dost watch over sin
transgression sealed bag thou sewest mine iniquity
surely mountain falling cometh nought rock removed out place
waters wear stones thou washest away things grow out dust earth destroyest hope man
thou prevailest ever against passeth changest countenance sendest away
sons come honour knoweth brought low perceiveth
flesh upon pain soul within mourn
then answered eliphaz temanite said
should wise man utter vain knowledge fill belly east wind
should reason unprofitable talk or speeches wherewith can do no good
yea thou castest off fear restrainest prayer before god
thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity thou choosest tongue crafty
thine own mouth condemneth thee yea lips testify against
art thou first man born or wast made before hills
hast thou heard secret god dost restrain wisdom thyself
what knowest thou we know understandest us
us both grayheaded very aged men much elder than thy father
consolations god small thee there any secret thing
why doth thine heart carry thee away what do thy eyes wink at
thou turnest thy spirit against god lettest such words go out mouth
what man should clean born woman righteous
behold putteth no trust saints yea heavens clean sight
how much more abominable filthy man drinketh iniquity like water
shew thee hear seen declare
wise men told fathers hid
whom alone earth given no stranger passed among
wicked man travaileth pain days number years hidden oppressor
dreadful sound ears prosperity destroyer come upon
believeth return out darkness waited sword
wandereth abroad bread saying where knoweth day darkness ready at hand

runneth upon even on neck thick bosses bucklers
because covereth face fatness maketh collops fat on flanks
dwelleth desolate cities houses no man inhabiteth ready become heaps
rich neither substance continue prolong perfection thereof upon earth
depart out darkness flame dry branches by breath mouth go away

heard many such things miserable comforters ye
vain words end or what emboldeneth thee thou answerest
also could speak ye do if your soul soul's stead heap words against you shake mine head at

now hath made weary thou hast desolate company

at ease hath broken asunder also taken by neck shaken pieces set mark
archers compass round about cleaveth reins asunder doth spare poureth out gall upon ground

any injustice mine hands also prayer pure
o earth cover thou blood let cry no place

few years come then go way whence return
breath corrupt days extinct graves ready
there mockers doth mine eye continue provocation
lay down now put surety thee who strike hands

speaketh flattery friends even eyes children fail
hath made also byword people aforetime tabret
mine eye also dim by reason sorrow members shadow
upright men astonied at innocent stir himself against hypocrite

days past purposes broken off even thoughts heart
change night day light short because darkness
if wait grave mine house made bed darkness

neither son nor nephew among people any remaining dwellings

then job answered said
how long ye vex soul break pieces words
these ten times ye reproached ashamed make yourselves strange
indeed erred mine error remaineth myself
if indeed ye magnify yourselves against plead reproach
know now god hath overthrown compassed net
behold cry out wrong am heard aloud there no judgment
hath fenced way cannot pass set darkness paths
hath stripped glory taken crown head
hath destroyed on every side am gone mine hope removed like tree
hath also kindled wrath against counteth one enemies
troops come together raise way against encamp round about tabernacle
hath put brethren far mine acquaintance verily estranged
kinsfolk failed familiar friends forgotten
dwell mine house maids count stranger am alien sight
called servant gave no answer intreated mouth
breath strange wife though intreated children's sake mine own body
yea young children despised arose spake against

pity upon o ye friends hand god hath touched
why do ye persecute god satisfied flesh
oh words now written printed book
graven iron pen lead rock ever
know redeemer liveth stand at latter day upon earth
though after skin worms destroy body yet flesh see god
whom see myself mine eyes behold another though reins consumed within
ye should say why persecute we seeing root matter found
ye afraid sword wrath bringeth punishments may know there judgment
then answered zophar naamathite said
therefore do thoughts cause answer make haste
heard check reproach spirit understanding causeth answer
knowest thou old since man placed upon earth
triumphing wicked short joy hypocrite moment
though excellency mount heavens head reach clouds
yet perish ever like own dung seen say where
fly away dream found yea chased vision night
eye also saw see no more neither place any behold
children seek please poor hands restore goods
bones full sin youth lie down dust
though wickedness sweet mouth hide under tongue
though spare forsake keep still within mouth

see rivers floods brooks honey butter

job answered said
hear diligently speech let your consolations
suffer may speak after spoken mock on
complaint man if so why should spirit troubled
mark astonished lay your hand upon mouth
even remember am afraid trembling taketh hold on flesh
wherefore do wicked live become old yea mighty power

houses safe fear neither rod god upon

take timbrel harp rejoice at sound organ
spend days wealth moment go down grave
therefore say god depart us we desire knowledge thy ways
what almighty we should serve profit if pray
lo good hand counsel wicked far
how oft candle wicked put out cometh destruction upon god distributeth sorrows anger
stubble before wind chaff storm carrieth away
god layeth iniquity children rewardeth know
eyes see destruction drink wrath almighty
what pleasure hath house after number months cut off midst
any teach god knowledge seeing judgeth those high
one dieth full strength being wholly at ease quiet
breasts full milk bones moistened marrow
another dieth bitterness soul never eateth pleasure

behold know your thoughts devices ye wrongfully imagine against

ye asked go by way do know tokens
wicked reserved day destruction brought forth wrath
who declare way face repay what hath done
yet brought grave remain tomb

then eliphaz temanite answered said
can man profitable god wise may himself
any pleasure almighty thou art righteous or gain makest thy ways perfect
reprove thee fear enter judgment
thy wickedness great thine iniquities infinite
thou hast taken pledge thy brother nought stripped naked clothing
thou hast given water weary drink withholden bread hungry
mighty man had earth honourable dwelt
thou hast sent widows away empty arms fatherless been broken
therefore snares round about thee sudden fear troubleth
or darkness thou canst see abundance waters cover thee
god height heaven behold stars how high
thou sayest how doth god know can judge through dark cloud
thick clouds covering seeth walketh circuit heaven
hast thou marked old way wicked men trodden
cut down out time whose foundation overflown flood
said god depart us what can almighty do
yet filled houses good things counsel wicked far
righteous see glad innocent laugh scorn
whereas our substance cut down remnant fire consumeth

receive pray thee law mouth lay words thine heart

then shalt thou lay gold dust ophir stones brooks

then shalt thou thy delight almighty lift face god
thou shalt make thy prayer hear thee pay vows

men cast down then thou shalt say there lifting save humble person
deliver island innocent delivered by pureness thine hands
then job answered said
even day complaint bitter stroke heavier than groaning
oh knew where might find come even seat
would order cause before fill mouth arguments
would know words answer understand what say
plead against great power no would put strength
there righteous might dispute so should delivered ever judge
behold go forward there backward cannot perceive
on left hand where doth work cannot behold hideth himself right see
knoweth way take hath tried come forth gold
foot hath held steps way kept declined
neither gone back commandment lips esteemed words mouth more than necessary food
one mind who can turn what soul desireth even doeth
performeth thing appointed many such things
therefore am troubled at presence consider afraid
god maketh heart soft almighty troubleth
because cut off before darkness neither hath covered face
why seeing times hidden almighty do know see days
some remove landmarks violently take away flocks feed thereof
drive away ass fatherless take widow's ox pledge
turn needy out way poor earth hide themselves together
behold wild asses desert go forth work rising betimes prey wilderness yieldeth food children

cause naked lodge without clothing no covering cold

job answered said
how hast thou helped without power savest arm hath no strength
how hast thou counselled hath no wisdom plentifully declared thing

dead things formed under waters inhabitants thereof
hell naked before destruction hath no covering

moreover job continued parable said
god liveth who hath taken away judgment almighty vexed soul
while breath spirit god nostrils
lips speak wickedness nor tongue utter deceit
god forbid should justify you till die remove mine integrity
righteousness hold fast let go heart reproach so long live
let mine enemy wicked riseth against unrighteous
what hope hypocrite though hath gained god taketh away soul

delight himself almighty always call upon god
teach you by hand god almighty conceal
behold ye yourselves seen why then thus altogether vain
portion wicked man god heritage oppressors receive almighty
if children multiplied sword offspring satisfied bread
those remain buried death widows weep

men clap hands at hiss out place
surely there vein silver place gold where fine
