dwell at jerusalem rulers because knew nor yet voices prophets read every sabbath day fulfilled condemning
though found no cause death yet desired pilate should slain
had fulfilled written took down tree laid sepulchre
god raised dead
seen many days came galilee jerusalem who witnesses people
we declare you glad tidings how promise made fathers
god hath fulfilled same us children raised jesus again also written second psalm thou art son day begotten thee
concerning raised dead now no more return corruption said on wise give you sure mercies david
wherefore saith also another psalm thou shalt suffer thine holy one see corruption
david after had served own generation by god fell on sleep laid fathers saw corruption
whom god raised again saw no corruption
known you therefore men brethren through man preached forgiveness sins
by believe justified things ye could law moses
beware therefore lest come upon you spoken prophets
behold ye despisers wonder perish work your days no wise believe though man declare you
jews gone out synagogue gentiles besought these words might preached next sabbath
now congregation broken many jews religious proselytes followed paul barnabas who speaking persuaded continue grace god
next sabbath day came almost whole city together hear word god
jews saw multitudes filled envy spake against those things spoken by paul contradicting blaspheming
then paul barnabas waxed bold said necessary word god should first been spoken you seeing ye put judge yourselves unworthy everlasting life lo we turn gentiles
so hath lord commanded us saying set thee light gentiles thou shouldest salvation ends earth
gentiles heard glad glorified word lord many ordained eternal life believed
word lord published throughout region
jews stirred devout honourable women chief men city raised persecution against paul barnabas expelled out coasts
shook off dust feet against came iconium
disciples filled joy holy ghost
came pass iconium went both together synagogue jews so spake great multitude also greeks believed
unbelieving jews stirred gentiles made minds evil affected against brethren
long time therefore abode speaking boldly lord gave testimony word grace granted signs wonders done by hands
multitude city divided part held jews apostles
there assault made both gentiles also jews rulers use despitefully stone
ware fled lystra derbe cities lycaonia region lieth round about
there preached gospel
there sat certain man at lystra impotent feet being cripple mother's womb who never had walked
same heard paul speak who stedfastly beholding perceiving had faith healed
said loud voice stand upright on thy feet leaped walked
people saw what paul had done lifted voices saying speech lycaonia gods come down us likeness men
called barnabas jupiter paul mercurius because chief speaker
then priest jupiter before city brought oxen garlands gates would done sacrifice people
apostles barnabas paul heard rent clothes ran among people crying out
saying sirs why do ye these things we also men like passions you preach should turn vanities living god made heaven earth sea therein
who times past suffered nations walk own ways
nevertheless left himself without witness did good gave us rain heaven fruitful seasons filling our hearts food gladness
these sayings scarce restrained people had done sacrifice
there came thither certain jews antioch iconium who persuaded people having stoned paul drew out city supposing had been dead
howbeit disciples stood round about rose came city next day departed barnabas derbe
had preached gospel city taught many returned again lystra iconium antioch
confirming souls disciples exhorting continue faith we must through much tribulation enter kingdom god
had ordained elders every church prayed fasting commended lord on whom believed
after had passed throughout pisidia came pamphylia
had preached word perga went down attalia
thence sailed antioch whence had been recommended grace god work fulfilled
come had gathered church together rehearsed god done how opened door faith gentiles
there abode long time disciples
certain men came down judaea taught brethren said except ye circumcised after manner moses cannot saved
therefore paul barnabas had no small dissension disputation determined certain other should go jerusalem apostles elders about question
being brought on way by church passed through phenice samaria declaring conversion gentiles caused great joy brethren
come jerusalem received church apostles elders declared things god had done
there rose certain sect pharisees believed saying needful circumcise command keep law moses
apostles elders came together consider matter
there had been much disputing peter rose said men brethren ye know how good while ago god made choice among us gentiles by mouth should hear word gospel believe
god knoweth hearts bare witness giving holy ghost even did us
put no difference between us purifying hearts by faith
now therefore why tempt ye god put yoke upon neck disciples neither our fathers nor we able bear
we believe through grace lord jesus christ saved even
then multitude kept silence gave audience barnabas paul declaring what miracles wonders god had wrought among gentiles by
after had held peace james answered saying men brethren hearken
simeon hath declared how god at first did visit gentiles take out people name
agree words prophets written
after return build again tabernacle david fallen down ruins thereof set
residue men might seek after lord gentiles upon whom name called saith who doeth these things
known god works beginning world
wherefore sentence we trouble among gentiles turned god
we write abstain pollutions idols fornication things strangled blood
moses old time hath every city preach being read synagogues sabbath day
then pleased apostles elders whole church send chosen men own company antioch paul barnabas namely judas surnamed barsabas silas chief among brethren
wrote letters by after manner apostles elders brethren send greeting gentiles antioch syria cilicia
forasmuch we heard certain went out us troubled you words subverting your souls saying ye must circumcised keep law whom gave no such commandment
seemed good us being assembled one accord send chosen men you our beloved barnabas paul
men hazarded lives name our lord jesus christ
we sent therefore judas silas who also tell you same things by mouth
seemed good holy ghost us lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things
ye abstain meats offered idols blood things strangled fornication if keep yourselves do well fare
so dismissed came antioch had gathered multitude together delivered epistle
had read rejoiced consolation
judas silas being prophets also themselves exhorted brethren many words confirmed
after had tarried there space let go peace brethren apostles
notwithstanding pleased silas abide there still
paul also barnabas continued antioch teaching preaching word lord many others
some days after paul said barnabas let us go again visit our brethren every city where we preached word lord see how do
barnabas determined take john whose surname mark
paul thought good take who departed pamphylia went work
contention so sharp between departed asunder one other barnabas took mark sailed cyprus
paul chose silas departed being recommended by brethren grace god
went through syria cilicia confirming churches
then came derbe lystra behold certain disciple there named timotheus son woman jewess believed father greek
well reported by brethren at lystra iconium
would paul go forth took circumcised because jews those quarters knew father greek
went through cities delivered decrees keep ordained apostles elders at jerusalem
so churches established faith increased number daily
now had gone throughout phrygia region galatia forbidden holy ghost preach word asia
after come mysia assayed go bithynia spirit suffered
passing by mysia came down troas
vision appeared paul night there stood man macedonia prayed saying come over help us
after had seen vision immediately we endeavoured go macedonia assuredly gathering lord called us preach gospel
therefore loosing troas we came straight course samothracia next day neapolis
thence philippi chief city part macedonia colony we abiding certain days
on sabbath we went out city by river side where prayer wont made sat down spake women resorted thither
certain woman named lydia seller purple city thyatira worshipped god heard us whose heart lord opened she attended things spoken paul
she baptized her household besought us saying if ye judged faithful lord come house abide there constrained
came pass we went prayer certain damsel possessed spirit divination met us brought her masters much gain by soothsaying
same followed paul us cried saying these men servants most high god shew way salvation
did she many days paul being grieved turned said spirit command thee name jesus christ come out her came same hour
her masters saw hope gains gone caught paul silas drew marketplace rulers
brought magistrates saying these men being jews do exceedingly trouble our city
teach customs lawful us receive neither observe being romans
multitude rose together against magistrates rent off clothes commanded beat
had laid many stripes upon cast prison charging jailor keep safely
who having received such charge thrust inner prison made feet fast stocks
at midnight paul silas prayed sang praises god prisoners heard
suddenly there great earthquake so foundations prison shaken immediately doors opened every one's bands loosed
keeper prison awaking out sleep seeing doors open drew sword would killed himself supposing prisoners had been fled
paul cried loud voice saying do thyself no harm we here
then called light sprang came trembling fell down before paul silas
brought out said sirs what must do saved
said believe on lord jesus christ thou shalt saved thy house
spake word lord house
took same hour night washed stripes baptized straightway
had brought house set meat before rejoiced believing god
day magistrates sent serjeants saying let those men go
keeper prison told saying paul magistrates sent let you go now therefore depart peace
paul said beaten us openly uncondemned being romans cast prison now do thrust out privily nay verily let come themselves fetch
serjeants told these words magistrates feared heard romans
came besought brought out desired depart city
went out prison entered house lydia had seen brethren comforted departed
now had passed through amphipolis apollonia came thessalonica where synagogue jews
paul manner went three sabbath days reasoned out scriptures
opening alleging christ must needs suffered risen again dead jesus whom preach you
some believed consorted paul silas devout greeks great multitude chief women few
jews believed moved envy took certain lewd fellows baser sort gathered company set city on uproar assaulted house jason sought bring out people
found drew jason certain brethren rulers city crying these turned world upside down come hither also
whom jason hath received these do contrary decrees caesar saying there another king one jesus
troubled people rulers city heard these things
had taken security jason other let go
brethren immediately sent away paul silas by night berea who coming thither went synagogue jews
these more noble than those thessalonica received word readiness mind searched scriptures daily whether things so
therefore many believed also honourable women greeks men few
jews thessalonica had knowledge word god preached paul at berea came thither also stirred people
then immediately brethren sent away paul go sea silas timotheus abode there still
conducted paul brought athens receiving commandment silas timotheus come speed departed
now while paul waited at athens spirit stirred saw city wholly given idolatry
therefore disputed synagogue jews devout persons market daily met
then certain philosophers epicureans stoicks encountered some said what babbler say other seemeth setter forth strange gods because preached jesus resurrection
took brought areopagus saying may we know what new doctrine whereof thou speakest
thou bringest certain strange things our ears we would know therefore what these mean
athenians strangers there spent time nothing else either tell or hear some new thing
then paul stood midst mars' hill said ye men athens perceive things too superstitious
passed by beheld your devotions found altar inscription unknown god whom therefore ye ignorantly worship declare you
god made world things therein seeing lord heaven earth dwelleth temples hands
neither worshipped men's hands though needed any thing seeing giveth life breath things
hath made one blood nations men dwell on face earth determined times before appointed bounds habitation
should seek lord if haply might feel after find though far every one us
we live move our being certain also your own poets said offspring
forasmuch then we offspring god ought think godhead like gold or silver stone graven by art man's device
times ignorance god winked at now commandeth men every where repent
because hath appointed day judge world righteousness by man whom ordained whereof given assurance men raised dead
heard resurrection dead some mocked others said we hear thee again matter
so paul departed among
howbeit certain men clave believed among dionysius areopagite woman named damaris others
after these things paul departed athens came corinth
found certain jew named aquila born pontus lately come italy wife priscilla because claudius had commanded jews depart rome came
because same craft abode wrought by occupation tentmakers
reasoned synagogue every sabbath persuaded jews greeks
silas timotheus come macedonia paul pressed spirit testified jews jesus christ
opposed themselves blasphemed shook raiment said your blood upon own heads am clean henceforth go gentiles
departed thence entered certain man's house named justus one worshipped god whose joined hard synagogue
crispus chief ruler synagogue believed on lord house many corinthians hearing baptized
then spake lord paul night by vision afraid speak hold thy peace
am thee no man set on hurt much people city
continued there year six months teaching word god among
gallio deputy achaia jews made insurrection one accord against paul brought judgment seat
saying fellow persuadeth men worship god contrary law
paul now about open mouth gallio said jews if matter wrong or wicked lewdness o ye reason would should bear you
if question words names your law look ye no judge such matters
drave judgment seat
then greeks took sosthenes chief ruler synagogue beat before judgment seat gallio cared none those things
paul after tarried there yet good while then took leave brethren sailed thence syria priscilla aquila having shorn head cenchrea had vow
came ephesus left there himself entered synagogue reasoned jews
desired tarry longer time consented
bade farewell saying must by means keep feast cometh jerusalem return again you if god sailed ephesus
had landed at caesarea gone saluted church went down antioch
after had spent some time there departed went over country galatia phrygia order strengthening disciples
certain jew named apollos born at alexandria eloquent man mighty scriptures came ephesus
man instructed way lord being fervent spirit spake taught diligently things knowing only baptism john
began speak boldly synagogue whom aquila priscilla had heard took expounded way god more perfectly
disposed pass achaia brethren wrote exhorting disciples receive who come helped much had believed through grace
mightily convinced jews publickly shewing by scriptures jesus christ
came pass while apollos at corinth paul having passed through upper coasts ephesus finding certain disciples
said ye received holy ghost since believed we so much heard whether there any
said what then ye baptized john's baptism
then said paul john verily baptized baptism repentance saying people should believe on come after christ jesus
heard baptized name lord jesus
paul had laid hands upon holy ghost came on spake tongues prophesied
men about twelve
went synagogue spake boldly space three months disputing persuading things concerning kingdom god
divers hardened believed spake evil way before multitude departed separated disciples disputing daily school one tyrannus
continued by space two years so dwelt asia heard word lord jesus both jews greeks
god wrought special miracles by hands paul
so body brought sick handkerchiefs or aprons diseases departed evil spirits went out
then certain vagabond jews exorcists took upon call over had evil spirits name lord jesus saying we adjure you by whom paul preacheth
there seven sons one sceva jew chief priests did so
evil spirit answered said jesus know paul who ye
man whom evil spirit leaped on overcame prevailed against so fled out house naked wounded
known jews greeks also dwelling at ephesus fear fell on name lord jesus magnified
many believed came confessed shewed deeds
many also used curious arts brought books together burned before men counted price found fifty thousand pieces silver
so mightily grew word god prevailed
after these things ended paul purposed spirit had passed through macedonia achaia go jerusalem saying been there must also see rome
so sent macedonia two ministered timotheus erastus himself stayed asia season
same time there arose no small stir about way
certain man named demetrius silversmith made silver shrines diana brought no small gain craftsmen
whom called together workmen like occupation said sirs ye know by craft we our wealth
moreover ye see hear alone at ephesus almost throughout asia paul hath persuaded turned away much people saying no gods made hands
so only our craft danger set at nought also temple great goddess diana should despised her magnificence destroyed whom asia world worshippeth
heard these sayings full wrath cried out saying great diana ephesians
whole city filled confusion having caught gaius aristarchus men macedonia paul's companions travel rushed one accord theatre
paul would entered people disciples suffered
certain chief asia friends sent desiring would adventure himself theatre
some therefore cried one thing another assembly confused more part knew wherefore come together
drew alexander out multitude jews putting forward beckoned hand would made defence people
knew jew one voice about space two hours cried out great diana ephesians
townclerk had appeased people said ye men ephesus what man there knoweth how city ephesians worshipper great goddess diana image fell down jupiter
seeing then these things cannot spoken against ye ought quiet do nothing rashly
ye brought hither these men neither robbers churches nor yet blasphemers your goddess
wherefore if demetrius craftsmen matter against any man law open there deputies let implead one another
if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters determined lawful assembly
we danger called question day's uproar there being no cause whereby may give account concourse
had thus spoken dismissed assembly
after uproar ceased paul called disciples embraced departed go macedonia
had gone over those parts given much exhortation came greece
there abode three months jews laid wait about sail syria purposed return through macedonia
there accompanied asia sopater berea thessalonians aristarchus secundus gaius derbe timotheus tychicus trophimus
these going before tarried us at troas
we sailed away philippi after days unleavened bread came troas five where abode seven
upon first day week disciples came together break bread paul preached ready depart on morrow continued speech until midnight
there many lights upper chamber where gathered together
there sat window certain young man named eutychus being fallen deep sleep paul long preaching sunk down fell third loft taken dead
paul went down fell on embracing said trouble yourselves life
therefore come again had broken bread eaten talked long while even till break day so departed
brought young man alive little comforted
we went before ship sailed assos there intending take paul so had appointed minding himself go afoot
met us at assos we took came mitylene
we sailed thence came next day over against chios arrived at samos tarried trogyllium miletus
paul had determined sail by ephesus because would spend time asia hasted if possible at jerusalem day pentecost
miletus sent ephesus called elders church
come said ye know first day came asia after what manner been you at seasons
serving lord humility mind many tears temptations befell by lying wait jews
how kept back nothing profitable you shewed taught publickly house
testifying both jews also greeks repentance toward god faith our lord jesus christ
now behold go bound spirit jerusalem knowing things befall there
save holy ghost witnesseth every city saying bonds afflictions abide
none these things move neither count life dear myself so might finish course joy ministry received lord jesus testify gospel grace god
now behold know ye among whom gone preaching kingdom god see face no more
wherefore take you record day am pure blood men
shunned declare you counsel god
take heed therefore yourselves flock over holy ghost hath made you overseers feed church god purchased own blood
know after departing grievous wolves enter among you sparing flock
also your own selves men arise speaking perverse things draw away disciples after
therefore watch remember by space three years ceased warn every one night day tears
now brethren commend you god word grace able build give inheritance among sanctified
coveted no man's silver or gold apparel
yea ye yourselves know these hands ministered necessities
shewed you things how so labouring ye ought support weak remember words lord jesus said more blessed give than receive
had thus spoken kneeled down prayed
wept sore fell on paul's neck kissed
sorrowing most words spake should see face no more accompanied ship
came pass after we gotten had launched straight course coos day following rhodes thence patara
finding ship sailing over phenicia we went aboard set forth
now we had discovered cyprus left on hand sailed syria landed at tyre there ship unlade her burden
finding disciples we tarried there seven days who said paul through spirit should go jerusalem
we had accomplished those days departed went our way brought us on wives children till out city kneeled down shore prayed
we had taken our leave one another took ship returned home again
we had finished our course tyre came ptolemais saluted brethren abode one day
next day we paul's company departed came caesarea entered house philip evangelist one seven abode
same man had four daughters virgins did prophesy
we tarried there many days came down judaea certain prophet named agabus
come us took paul's girdle bound own hands feet said thus saith holy ghost so jews at jerusalem bind man owneth deliver gentiles
we heard these things both place besought go jerusalem
then paul answered what mean ye weep break mine heart am ready bound only also die at jerusalem name lord jesus
would persuaded we ceased saying lord done
after those days we took our carriages went jerusalem
there went us also certain disciples caesarea brought one mnason cyprus old disciple whom we should lodge
we come jerusalem brethren received us gladly
day following paul went us james elders present
had saluted declared particularly what things god wrought among gentiles by ministry
heard glorified lord said thou seest brother how many thousands jews there believe zealous law
informed thee thou teachest jews among gentiles forsake moses saying ought circumcise children neither walk after customs
what therefore multitude must needs come together hear thou art
do therefore we say thee four men vow on
take purify thyself at charges may shave heads know those things whereof informed concerning thee nothing thou also walkest orderly keepest law
touching gentiles believe we written concluded observe no such thing save only keep themselves things offered idols blood strangled fornication
then paul took men next day purifying himself entered temple signify accomplishment days purification until offering should offered every one
seven days almost ended jews asia saw temple stirred people laid hands on
crying out men israel help man teacheth every where against people law place further brought greeks also temple hath polluted holy
had seen before city trophimus ephesian whom supposed paul brought temple
city moved people ran together took paul drew out temple forthwith doors shut
went about kill tidings came chief captain band jerusalem uproar
who immediately took soldiers centurions ran down saw chief captain left beating paul
then chief captain came near took commanded bound two chains demanded who what had done
some cried one thing another among multitude could know certainty tumult commanded carried castle
came upon stairs so borne soldiers violence people
multitude people followed after crying away
paul led castle said chief captain may speak thee who canst thou greek
art thou egyptian before these days madest uproar leddest out wilderness four thousand men murderers
paul said am man jew tarsus city cilicia citizen no mean beseech thee suffer speak people
had given licence paul stood on stairs beckoned hand people there made great silence spake hebrew tongue saying
men brethren fathers hear ye defence make now you
heard spake hebrew tongue kept more silence saith
am verily man jew born tarsus city cilicia yet brought at feet gamaliel taught according perfect manner law fathers zealous toward god ye day
persecuted way death binding delivering prisons both men women
also high priest doth bear witness estate elders whom received letters brethren went damascus bring there bound jerusalem punished
came pass made journey come nigh damascus about noon suddenly there shone heaven great light round
fell ground heard voice saying saul why persecutest thou
answered who art thou lord said am jesus nazareth whom persecutest
saw indeed light afraid heard voice spake
said what do lord arise go damascus there told thee things appointed
could see glory light being led by hand came damascus
one ananias devout man according law having good report jews dwelt there
came stood said brother saul receive thy sight same hour looked upon
said god our fathers hath chosen thee thou shouldest know see just one hear voice mouth
thou shalt witness men what hast seen heard
now why tarriest thou arise baptized wash away thy sins calling on name lord
came pass come again jerusalem even while prayed temple trance
saw saying make haste get thee quickly out jerusalem receive thy testimony concerning
said lord know imprisoned beat every synagogue believed on thee
blood thy martyr stephen shed also standing by consenting death kept raiment slew
said depart send thee far hence gentiles
gave audience word then lifted voices said away such fellow earth fit should live
cried out cast off clothes threw dust air
chief captain commanded brought castle bade should examined by scourging might know wherefore cried so against
bound thongs paul said centurion stood by lawful you scourge man roman uncondemned
centurion heard went told chief captain saying take heed what thou doest man roman
then chief captain came said tell art thou roman yea
chief captain answered great sum obtained freedom paul said free born
then straightway departed should examined chief captain also afraid after knew roman because had bound
on morrow because would known certainty wherefore accused jews loosed bands commanded chief priests council appear brought paul down set before
paul earnestly beholding council said men brethren lived good conscience before god until day
high priest ananias commanded stood by smite on mouth
then said paul god smite thee thou whited wall sittest judge after law commandest smitten contrary
stood by said revilest thou god's high priest
then said paul wist brethren high priest written thou shalt speak evil ruler thy people
paul perceived one part sadducees other pharisees cried out council men brethren am pharisee son hope resurrection dead called question
had so said there arose dissension between pharisees sadducees multitude divided
sadducees say there no resurrection neither angel nor spirit pharisees confess both
there arose great cry scribes pharisees' part strove saying we find no evil man if spirit or angel hath spoken let us fight against god
there arose great dissension chief captain fearing lest paul should been pulled pieces commanded soldiers go down take by force among bring castle
night following lord stood by said good cheer paul thou hast testified jerusalem so must bear witness also at rome
day certain jews banded together bound themselves under curse saying would neither eat nor drink till had killed paul
more than forty had made conspiracy
came chief priests elders said we bound ourselves under great curse eat nothing until slain paul
now therefore ye council signify chief captain bring down you morrow though would enquire something more perfectly concerning we or ever come near ready kill
paul's sister's son heard lying wait went entered castle told paul
then paul called one centurions said bring young man chief captain hath certain thing tell
so took brought chief captain said paul prisoner called prayed bring young man thee who hath something say
then chief captain took by hand went aside privately asked what thou hast tell
said jews agreed desire thee thou wouldest bring down paul morrow council though would enquire somewhat more perfectly
do thou yield there lie wait more than forty men bound themselves oath neither eat nor drink till killed now ready looking promise thee
so chief captain then let young man depart charged see thou tell no hast shewed these things
called two centurions saying make ready hundred soldiers go caesarea horsemen threescore ten spearmen at third hour night
provide beasts may set paul on bring safe felix governor
wrote letter after manner
claudius lysias most excellent governor felix sendeth greeting
man taken jews should been killed then came army rescued having understood roman
would known cause wherefore accused brought forth council
whom perceived accused questions law nothing laid charge worthy death or bonds
told how jews laid wait man sent straightway thee gave commandment accusers also say before what had against farewell
then soldiers commanded took paul brought by night antipatris
on morrow left horsemen go returned castle
who came caesarea delivered epistle governor presented paul also before
governor had read letter asked what province understood cilicia
hear thee said thine accusers also come commanded kept herod's judgment hall
after five days ananias high priest descended elders certain orator named tertullus who informed governor against paul
called forth tertullus began accuse saying seeing by thee we enjoy great quietness very worthy deeds done nation thy providence
we accept always places most noble felix thankfulness
notwithstanding further tedious thee pray thou wouldest hear us thy clemency few words
we found man pestilent fellow mover sedition among jews throughout world ringleader sect nazarenes
who also hath gone about profane temple whom we took would judged according our law
chief captain lysias came upon us great violence took away out our hands
commanding accusers come thee by examining whom thyself mayest take knowledge these things whereof we accuse
jews also assented saying these things so
then paul after governor had beckoned speak answered forasmuch know thou hast been many years judge nation do more cheerfully answer myself
because thou mayest understand there yet twelve days since went jerusalem worship
neither found temple disputing any man raising people synagogues nor city
neither can prove things whereof now accuse
confess thee after way call heresy so worship god fathers believing things written law prophets
hope toward god themselves also allow there resurrection dead both just unjust
herein do exercise myself always conscience void offence toward god men
now after many years came bring alms nation offerings
whereupon certain jews asia found purified temple neither multitude nor tumult
who ought been here before thee object if had against
or else let these same here say if found any evil doing while stood before council
except one voice cried standing among touching resurrection dead am called question by you day
felix heard these things having more perfect knowledge way deferred said lysias chief captain come down know uttermost your matter
commanded centurion keep paul let liberty should forbid none acquaintance minister or come
after certain days felix came wife drusilla jewess sent paul heard concerning faith christ
reasoned righteousness temperance judgment come felix trembled answered go thy way time convenient season call thee
hoped also money should been given paul might loose wherefore sent oftener communed
after two years porcius festus came felix' room felix willing shew jews pleasure left paul bound
now festus come province after three days ascended caesarea jerusalem
then high priest chief jews informed against paul besought
desired favour against would send jerusalem laying wait way kill
festus answered paul should kept at caesarea himself would depart shortly thither
let therefore said among you able go down accuse man if there any wickedness
had tarried among more than ten days went down caesarea next day sitting on judgment seat commanded paul brought
come jews came down jerusalem stood round about laid many grievous complaints against paul could prove
while answered himself neither against law jews temple nor yet caesar offended any thing at
festus willing do jews pleasure answered paul said wilt thou go jerusalem there judged these things before
then said paul stand at caesar's judgment seat where ought judged jews done no wrong thou very well knowest
if offender or committed any thing worthy death refuse die there none these things whereof accuse no man may deliver appeal caesar
then festus had conferred council answered hast thou appealed caesar shalt go
after certain days king agrippa bernice came caesarea salute festus
had been there many days festus declared paul's cause king saying certain man left bonds by felix
about whom at jerusalem chief priests elders jews informed desiring judgment against
whom answered manner romans deliver any man die before accused accusers face licence answer himself concerning crime laid against
therefore come hither without any delay on morrow sat judgment seat commanded man brought forth
against whom accusers stood brought none accusation such things supposed
had certain questions against own superstition one jesus dead whom paul affirmed alive
because doubted such manner questions asked whether would go jerusalem there judged these matters
paul had appealed reserved hearing augustus commanded kept till might send caesar
then agrippa said festus would also hear man myself morrow thou shalt
on morrow agrippa come bernice great pomp entered place hearing chief captains principal men city at festus' commandment paul brought forth
festus said king agrippa men here present us ye see man about whom multitude jews dealt both at jerusalem also crying ought live any longer
found had committed nothing worthy death himself hath appealed augustus determined send
whom no certain thing write lord wherefore brought forth before you specially thee o king agrippa after examination had might somewhat
seemeth unreasonable send prisoner withal signify crimes laid against
then agrippa said paul thou art permitted speak thyself stretched forth hand answered himself
think myself happy king agrippa because answer day before thee touching things whereof am accused jews
especially because know thee expert customs questions among jews wherefore beseech hear patiently
manner life youth at first among mine own nation jerusalem know jews
knew beginning if would testify after most straitest sect our religion lived pharisee
now stand am judged hope promise made god our fathers
promise our twelve tribes instantly serving god day night hope come hope's sake king agrippa am accused jews
why should thought thing incredible you god raise dead
verily thought myself ought do many things contrary name jesus nazareth
thing also did jerusalem many saints shut prison having received authority chief priests put death gave voice against
punished oft every synagogue compelled blaspheme being exceedingly mad against persecuted even strange cities
whereupon went damascus authority commission chief priests
at midday o king saw way light heaven above brightness sun shining round about journeyed
we fallen earth heard voice speaking saying hebrew tongue saul why persecutest thou hard thee kick against pricks
said who art thou lord am jesus whom persecutest
rise stand upon thy feet appeared thee purpose make minister witness both these things thou hast seen those appear
delivering thee people gentiles whom now send
open eyes turn darkness light power satan god may receive forgiveness sins inheritance among sanctified by faith
whereupon o king agrippa disobedient heavenly vision
shewed first damascus at jerusalem throughout coasts judaea then gentiles should repent turn god do works meet repentance
these causes jews caught temple went about kill
having therefore obtained help god continue day witnessing both small great saying none other things than those prophets moses did say should come
christ should suffer first rise dead shew light people gentiles
thus spake himself festus said loud voice paul thou art beside thyself much learning doth make thee mad
said am mad most noble festus speak forth words truth soberness
king knoweth these things before whom also speak freely am persuaded none hidden thing done corner
king agrippa believest thou prophets know
then agrippa said paul almost thou persuadest christian
paul said would god only thou also hear day both almost altogether such am except these bonds
had thus spoken king rose governor bernice sat
gone aside talked between themselves saying man doeth nothing worthy death or bonds
then said agrippa festus man might been set at liberty if had appealed caesar
determined we should sail italy delivered paul certain other prisoners one named julius centurion augustus' band
entering ship adramyttium we launched meaning sail by coasts asia one aristarchus macedonian thessalonica being us
next day we touched at sidon julius courteously entreated paul gave liberty go friends refresh himself
we had launched thence sailed under cyprus because winds contrary
we had sailed over sea cilicia pamphylia came myra city lycia
there centurion found ship alexandria sailing italy put us therein
we had sailed slowly many days scarce come over against cnidus wind suffering us under crete salmone
hardly passing came place called fair havens nigh whereunto city lasea
now much time spent sailing dangerous because fast already past paul admonished
said sirs perceive voyage hurt much damage only lading ship also our lives
nevertheless centurion believed master owner ship more than those things spoken by paul
because haven commodious winter more part advised depart thence also if by any means might attain phenice there crete lieth toward south west north
south wind blew softly supposing had obtained purpose loosing thence sailed close by crete
long after there arose against tempestuous wind called euroclydon
ship caught could bear wind we let her drive
running under certain island called clauda we had much work come by boat
had taken used helps undergirding ship fearing lest should fall quicksands strake sail so driven
we being exceedingly tossed tempest next day lightened ship
third day we cast out our own hands tackling ship
neither sun nor stars many days appeared no small tempest lay on us hope we should saved then taken away
after long abstinence paul stood forth midst said sirs ye should hearkened loosed crete gained harm loss
now exhort you good cheer there no loss any man's life among ship
there stood by night angel god whose am whom serve
saying fear paul thou must brought before caesar lo god hath given thee sail
wherefore sirs good cheer believe god even told
howbeit we must cast upon certain island
fourteenth night come we driven down adria about midnight shipmen deemed drew near some country
sounded found twenty fathoms had gone little further again fifteen
then fearing lest we should fallen upon rocks cast four anchors out stern wished day
shipmen about flee out ship had let down boat sea under colour though would cast anchors foreship
paul said centurion soldiers except these abide ship ye cannot saved
then soldiers cut off ropes boat let her fall
while day coming on paul besought take meat saying fourteenth ye tarried continued fasting having taken nothing
wherefore pray you take some meat your health there hair fall head any
had thus spoken took bread gave thanks god presence broken began eat
then good cheer also took some meat
we ship two hundred threescore sixteen souls
had eaten enough lightened ship cast out wheat sea
day knew land discovered certain creek shore minded if possible thrust ship
had taken anchors committed themselves sea loosed rudder bands hoised mainsail wind made toward shore
falling place where two seas met ran ship aground forepart stuck fast remained unmoveable hinder part broken violence waves
soldiers' counsel kill prisoners lest any should swim out escape
centurion willing save paul kept purpose commanded could swim should cast themselves first sea get land
rest some on boards broken pieces ship so came pass escaped safe land
escaped then knew island called melita
barbarous people shewed us no little kindness kindled fire received every one because present rain cold
paul had gathered bundle sticks laid on fire there came viper out heat fastened hand
barbarians saw venomous beast hang on hand said among themselves no doubt man murderer whom though hath escaped sea yet vengeance suffereth live
shook off beast fire felt no harm
howbeit looked should swollen or fallen down dead suddenly after had great while saw no harm come changed minds said god
same quarters possessions chief man island whose name publius who received us lodged three days courteously
came pass father publius lay sick fever bloody flux whom paul entered prayed laid hands on healed
so done others also had diseases island came healed
who also honoured us many honours we departed laded such things necessary
after three months we departed ship alexandria had wintered isle whose sign castor pollux
landing at syracuse we tarried there three days
thence we fetched compass came rhegium after one day south wind blew next puteoli
where we found brethren desired tarry seven days so went toward rome
thence brethren heard us came meet far appii forum three taverns whom paul saw thanked god took courage
we came rome centurion delivered prisoners captain guard paul suffered dwell by himself soldier kept
came pass after three days paul called chief jews together come said men brethren though committed nothing against people or customs our fathers yet delivered prisoner jerusalem hands romans
who had examined would let go because there no cause death
jews spake against constrained appeal caesar had ought accuse nation
cause therefore called you see speak because hope israel am bound chain
said we neither received letters out judaea concerning thee any brethren came shewed or spake harm
we desire hear thee what thou thinkest concerning sect know every where spoken against
had appointed day there came many lodging whom expounded testified kingdom god persuading concerning jesus both out law moses prophets morning till evening
some believed things spoken

while we look at things seen temporal eternal

now hath wrought us selfsame thing god who also given earnest spirit
therefore we always confident knowing whilst at home body absent lord
we walk by faith sight
we confident say willing rather absent body present lord

we must appear before judgment seat christ every one may receive things done body according hath whether good or bad
knowing therefore terror lord we persuade men made manifest god trust also your consciences
we commend ourselves again you give occasion glory on our behalf ye may somewhat answer appearance heart
whether we beside ourselves god or sober your cause
love christ constraineth us because we thus judge if one died then dead
died live should henceforth themselves rose again
wherefore henceforth know we no man after flesh yea though known christ yet now more
therefore if any man christ new creature old things passed away behold become

wit god christ reconciling world himself imputing trespasses hath committed us word reconciliation

beseech thee son onesimus whom begotten bonds
time past thee unprofitable now profitable
whom sent again thou therefore receive mine own bowels
whom would retained thy stead might ministered bonds gospel
without thy mind would do nothing benefit should necessity willingly
perhaps therefore departed season thou shouldest receive ever
now servant above brother beloved specially how much more thee both flesh lord
if thou count therefore partner receive myself
if hath wronged thee or oweth ought put on mine account
paul written mine own hand repay albeit do say thee how thou owest even thine self besides
yea brother let joy thee lord refresh bowels
having confidence thy obedience wrote thee knowing thou wilt also do more than say
withal prepare also lodging trust through your prayers given you
there salute thee epaphras fellowprisoner christ jesus
marcus aristarchus demas lucas fellowlabourers
grace our lord jesus christ your spirit amen
god who at sundry times divers manners spake time past fathers by prophets
hath these last days spoken us by son whom appointed heir things also made worlds
who being brightness glory express image person upholding things by word power had himself purged our sins sat down on right hand majesty high
being made so much better than angels hath by inheritance obtained more excellent name
angels said at any time thou art son day begotten thee again father
again bringeth firstbegotten world saith let angels god worship
angels saith who maketh spirits ministers flame fire
son saith thy throne o god ever sceptre righteousness kingdom

perish thou remainest wax old doth garment
vesture shalt thou fold changed art same thy years fail
angels said at any time sit on right hand until make thine enemies thy footstool
ministering spirits sent forth minister who heirs salvation
therefore we ought give more earnest heed things heard lest at any time should let slip
if word spoken by angels stedfast every transgression disobedience received just recompence reward
how we escape if neglect so great salvation at first began spoken by lord confirmed us heard
god also bearing witness both signs wonders divers miracles gifts holy ghost according own

we believed do enter rest said sworn wrath if although works finished foundation world

who made after law carnal commandment power endless life

there verily disannulling commandment going before weakness unprofitableness thereof

inasmuch without oath made priest

what more say time would fail tell gedeon barak samson jephthae david also samuel prophets

do blaspheme worthy name by ye called
if ye fulfil royal law according scripture thou shalt love thy neighbour thyself do well
if ye respect persons commit sin convinced law transgressors
whosoever keep whole law yet offend one point guilty
said do commit adultery also kill now if thou no yet art become transgressor law
so speak ye do judged by law liberty
judgment without mercy hath shewed no rejoiceth against

if brother or sister naked destitute daily food
one you say depart peace ye warmed filled notwithstanding give those things needful body what doth profit
even so faith if hath works dead being alone

wilt thou know o vain man faith without works dead

seest thou how faith wrought works by made perfect
scripture fulfilled saith abraham believed god imputed righteousness called friend
ye see then how by works man justified faith only
likewise also rahab harlot justified by works she had received messengers sent out another way
body without spirit dead so faith works also
brethren many masters knowing we receive greater condemnation
many things we offend if any man word same perfect able also bridle whole body
behold we put bits horses' mouths may obey us turn about whole body
behold also ships though so great driven fierce winds yet turned about very small helm whithersoever governor listeth
even so tongue little member boasteth great things behold how matter fire kindleth
tongue fire world iniquity so among our members defileth whole body setteth on course nature set hell
every kind beasts birds serpents things sea tamed hath been mankind
tongue can no man tame unruly evil full deadly poison
therewith bless we god even father curse men made after similitude
out same mouth proceedeth blessing cursing brethren these things ought so
doth fountain send forth at same place sweet water bitter

who wise man endued knowledge among you let shew out good conversation works meekness wisdom
if ye bitter envying strife your hearts glory lie against truth

fruit righteousness sown peace make

there one lawgiver who able save destroy art thou judgest another

therefore knoweth do good doeth sin

ye condemned killed just doth resist you

so god well doing ye may put silence ignorance foolish men
free using your liberty cloke maliciousness servants god

thankworthy if man conscience toward god endure grief suffering wrongfully
what glory if ye buffeted your faults take patiently do well suffer acceptable god
even hereunto ye called because christ also suffered us leaving example should follow steps
who did no sin neither guile found mouth
who reviled again suffered threatened committed himself judgeth righteously
who own self bare our sins body on tree we being dead should live righteousness by whose stripes ye healed
ye sheep going astray now returned shepherd bishop your souls
likewise ye wives subjection your own husbands if any obey word also may without won by conversation
while behold your chaste conversation coupled fear
whose adorning let outward plaiting hair wearing gold or putting on apparel
let hidden man heart corruptible even ornament meek quiet spirit sight god great price
after manner old time holy women also who trusted god adorned themselves being subjection own husbands
even sara obeyed abraham calling lord whose daughters ye long do well afraid any amazement
likewise ye husbands dwell according knowledge giving honour wife weaker vessel being heirs together grace life your prayers hindered
finally ye one mind having compassion another love brethren pitiful courteous
rendering evil or railing contrariwise blessing knowing ye thereunto called should inherit
love life see good days let refrain tongue evil lips speak no guile
let eschew evil do good seek peace ensue
eyes lord over righteous ears open prayers face against do evil
who harm you if ye followers good
if ye suffer righteousness' sake happy afraid terror neither troubled
sanctify lord god your hearts ready always give answer every man asketh you reason hope meekness fear
having good conscience whereas speak evil you evildoers may ashamed falsely accuse your conversation christ
better if god so ye suffer well doing than evil
christ also hath once suffered sins just unjust might bring us god being put death flesh quickened by spirit

her sins reached heaven god hath remembered iniquities
reward her even she rewarded you double according works cup hath filled fill
how much she hath glorified herself lived deliciously so torment sorrow give her saith heart sit queen am no widow see
therefore her plagues come one day death mourning famine she utterly burned fire strong lord god who judgeth
kings earth who committed fornication lived deliciously her bewail lament see smoke burning
standing afar off fear her torment saying alas great city babylon mighty one hour thy judgment come
merchants earth weep mourn over her no man buyeth merchandise any more
merchandise gold silver precious stones pearls fine linen purple silk scarlet thyine wood manner vessels ivory most brass iron marble

fruits thy soul lusted after departed thee things dainty goodly thou shalt find no more at

saying alas great city clothed fine linen purple scarlet decked gold precious stones pearls
one hour so great riches come nought every shipmaster company ships sailors many trade by sea stood afar off
cried saw smoke her burning saying what city like great
